Reviews.Title: “perfection!”
Reviews.Author: foodtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: luxury rooms and stellar service! great cozy chic---felt like personal attention from checkin to checkout! fab location to wander and enjoy seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Alan M
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel weekly now for approximately two months so am basing this recommendation on multiple rooms, and a broad set of interactions with staff members from all aspects of the hotel's operations. As context, over the past 12 months I have stayed in hotels for more than 150 nights as I travel regularly for my employment. Against all of those hotels, the good, bad and ugly, Hotel 1000 very clearly distinguishes itself at the very top of the list. Based on something like 10 stays, I cannot name a single thing I would suggest needs improvement. Specific factors that make this place so outstanding for me include: -an absolute first-rate attitude toward guest service, shared by every single member of the staff, displayed in every interaction -amazing rooms, with furnishings and fixtures that are just superb, and panoramic harbour views if you end up on the water side -a great location steps from Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square, etc. -a tremendous restaurant and bar, fantastic bartenders

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon5
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is like the photos where we could see that a nearby hotel was not. Could stretch my legs full out in the tub. Molton Brown products to use lavishly. These are $30 a bottle everywhere. I looked when I returned home. Rooms are clean, stylish and hi-tech. Service is excellent although they did forget to send up the extra robe we requested. Not sure what happened with the sensors in the mini-bar, but they thought we had two items when we didn't but they did not charge us for the 2nd item. Maybe if you pick it up and put it back, it still sets it off? Microsoft board was frozen once in the lounge but working the next day. Only disappointment was BOKA restaurant which was extremely slow for breakfast - so slow it was painful. It looks like it is quite full during their happy hour though. Would definitely stay here again. Not sure if you know but this is in Conde Nast top list with scores even higher than the only other one in the list. Easy walk to market, museum and stores.

Reviews.Title: “if you want the best experience in seattle, don't look further”
Reviews.Author: Nekiv
Reviews.Content: i've been traveling regularly to seattle on business. i've stayed at most of the high end hotels in seattle and none of them has impressed me as much as 1000. from its amazingly designed rooms to its super cool and large bathrooms, everything is perfect. this hotel crew knows how to give you a great experience. i have a busy lifestyle and choosing my hotel in seattle is not one of them any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly bad taste in my mouth after this experience”
Reviews.Author: finaversaggi
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately what I thought would be a great stay turned into a nightmare. Found this hotel through Hotels.com and experienced what I thought was a great stay despite the fact that the wireless connectivity did not work and this was a business stay. Fortunately it was possible to use direct wired connection, but the hotel did not provide LAN cables long enough to work at a desk or table, which made things quite difficult. Nonetheless, I checked out a happy customer. However, I found multiple charges on my credit card on the days following checkout - much more than I actually owed, one for $1000 (on top of another for $123.10). I called the hotel to find out what was going on, and they told me that it was a charge for a cracked screen on the TV! I can't believe this. There were 2 TVs in this room, both LCD and I watched them both and they were just fine when I left. Now I am waiting to hear back from a manager because the front desk wasn't able to resolve this issue? PS. expensive parking (almost $40 per night). I won't be back after all. Taking this much time to resolve an issue like this is beyond ridiculous. My husband and I are 50 something business people, not rock stars who damage hotel rooms. In fact, I clean hotel rooms before tipping the cleaning people $5/day! I'm really unhappy with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Inn at the Market, but tried this hotel for the first time and was beyond pleasantly surprised. We will stay here for all of our future travel to the Seattle area. Accommodated our family of 4 wonderfully. The bathtub was wonderful! They pay attention to all of the details and the valet staff was wonderful. They even left two cold water bottles for us in the car as we were departing. Conveniently located for a short walk to the Pike Place Market, or the waterfront. Thanks for a great stay Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rick O
Reviews.Content: You know how all those national chain hotels begin to run together? Yeah, they're clean and predictable. But when I stayed at Hotel 1000 this week, I realized what I had been missing from my frequent business trips - an EXPERIENCE! The rooms are big; bathrooms are modern, funky, and spotless; the decor throughout the property was intriguing. I spent a little time in their fire pit room off the lobby meeting with friends. I had nice private chats with my staff in the library. And the food? Awesome! If I ever get back to Seattle again, there is only one hotel I would ever consider, and that's Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “OMG....after all these years”
Reviews.Author: Joe C
Reviews.Content: After years of hotels nationally, finally one 'gets it'. From over the top friendly to solid construction, this place does it all!! The key for me is bathroom lighting and construction quality. No cracks in walls anywhere. I have stayed in the most luxurious hotels and never have I had the feeling of comfort that we enjoyed here at the 1000 in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: riesenweber3131
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well furnished and have comfortable beds. The bathrooms are spacious with large showers. We stayed in the lux parlor suite and loved it. The staff at the hotel were all kind, courteous and helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: CatherineKim
Reviews.Content: The front desk and bell staff were exceptional. Upon our arrival very early in the morning, Alice at the front desk offered great suggestions for places to go and things to do while we waited for our room to be readied. We understood check-in wasn't available until 4pm when we reserved our room, but the staff were kind enough to have a room available for us by 11:30am, which was much appreciated after flying all night. The bell desk offered umbrellas and attentive service as well as easy directions and great suggestions for places to go and how to get there. The bar staff at Boka was also very friendly and personable. On the multiple occasions that we visited the bar, they were entertaining and made great cocktails. The in-room mini-bar is quite well stocked; unfortunately, it didn't leave room for the small items that we picked up throughout the week. - Beechers and Cougar Gold don't survive well at room temps. There may well have been small refrigerators available had we asked, sadly, we didn't think of it until we left. The only hiccup we encountered was the service in the Golf Club which was not up to the same great standards as everything else in the hotel. We waited for an hour before a server checked on us only to have them forget our cocktails twice and to bring our check at the end of our game. While the hotel is a great location for accessing Pike Place Market and the waterfront (cruises, ferries, the Aquarium) it's a bit further from the retail district - Pacific Place, Nordstrom, Westlake Center, etc. and if you're planning to visit the Space Needle, EMP, Pacific Science Center, it's a small trek through Belltown. Regardless, we had a great stay and will reserve again on our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A very special Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveSun324
Reviews.Content: A very special Hotel, we have stayed here on several occasions and each time has been amazing. From the inital welcome of the valet to the excellent spa staff, each encounter has in the past been wonderful. That is until our last trip there... We checked in for a birthday weekend, we went to discuss dinner plans and show arrangments with the concierge and it was made very clear by him that we were bothering him seeking his service and taking him away from looking at his email. He stated that he would "find us a place" and "would give us a call". Three hours later we called the concierge desk only to find out that he had left for the day with no call and no arrangments for dinner. Not so nice!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoAnM
Reviews.Content: While on vacation i stayed here a few days. The rates were incredible. I was in a room with a soaked bath tub, city-view, and also free champagne when I arrived. My room was also upgraded when I called. The television had my name on it to elcome me. The spa was wonderful and I had the Lomi Lomi massage. It was an amazing vacation mingled in with Seattles diverse culture and arts. I was really happy! It definitely put the Kimpton hotel across the street to shame and also the W hotel Seattle to shame. The staffs were great and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average All The Way Around”
Reviews.Author: david w
Reviews.Content: Had heard wonderful recommendations about the Hotel 1000 and wanted to experience the hotel for ourselves. Having only been to Seattle a few times we thought the location was prefect for exploring the down town area. The overall experience was excellent from the front door to the room and food service/quality. Everyone went out of their way make our stay special. We lunch at the restaurant the first day and enjoyed the food and service. The room was excellent throughout. The pricing was correct for the level of service we received. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtrip2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a wedding in March. The weather was terrible, but the stay was terrific! The hotel was clean and classy.We had a city view room with a king size bed and it was well worth the price. It was spacious and had every amenity we needed. The TV and furnishings were new and modern. The bathroom had a cool glass divider with an electronic shade that could cover the view of the stand alone tub. To fill the tub you turned the faucet and the water flowed from the ceiling! The staff was kind and helpful during check in and when we had questions about transportation. We were able to enjoy the Spahhh! Our couples massage was perfect after a day in the Seattle rain. I am most impressed that the manager of the hotel has actually answered many of the reviews on Trip Advisor. That is customer service at its finest!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: TollyRogerVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid week and was pleased that this hotel still has the staff that "goes the extra mile" to provide GREAT customer service. The room was excellent and we loved the view of the waterfront. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday night”
Reviews.Author: Brittany A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding! We walked to dinner and the location of the hotel was very convenient. The room was amazing! We have an awesome night!!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy downtown corner location is a problem”
Reviews.Author: RobertG29
Reviews.Content: Context: 1 night stay before going to Sea-Tac airport Pros: Interesting room decor Nice bathrooms Cons: I see all the great reviews of this hotel and I just don't get it. No amount of great service, amenities etc. can overcome the fact that this is on a very noisy street and you will listen to cars, trucks, buses, motorcyles and ambulances all night. Maybe there are rooms at the back that are quieter. But I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmed: like I was the President or something!”
Reviews.Author: Analog T
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the middle of the week. Beautiful hotel. The staff went out of their wai to get us a room with a wonderful view. We went sight seeing and left our luggage at the front desk before check in. They called us when our room was ready. The room was STUNNING. The view was STUNNING. I didn't pay for a view, but they gave it to us because it was available. Everyone treated us like we were royalty or something. Really. From the front desk to the valets to the restaurant. And the people in Seattle were friendly too! What a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience, best hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: desi176
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best service my wife and I have ever received. This beats the Ritz or Four Seasons any day of the week. I simply valeted my car and by the time I walked to the front desk, Alice greeted me by name. It didn't stop there; every single interaction with the staff was exceptional. By the end of our first night's stay, I had to go downstairs to ask for a manager to tell her how special Hotel 1000 is. Even the room service was delivered by a truly kind and courteous bellman; and the breakfast was terrific. The truth of the matter is, everyone is genuinely pleasant! They're not just helpful because it's their job, they really seem to take pleasure out of providing world class service. So refreshing! We will absolutely stay at Hotel 1000 every time we visit Seattle. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, cozy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: cassterson
Reviews.Content: Best hotel experience I've had in ages. Very comfortable room, super quiet (we were on the 8ther floor with no traffic noise), great room service and the staff was so friendly and helpful. I would love to stay here in every city I go to. The wifi was free too. Double bonus! The location is awesome as well. Super close walk, 4 blocks I think, to Pike's market and maybe 6-8 for shopping

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Attention To Detail”
Reviews.Author: BarristerWinery
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted at the curb by the valet, it was evident that every possible detail had been attended to to assure that our stay was a complete joy. Bubbles at check-in, beautifully appointed room, bath with a stunning view (you won't believe how the tub fills), spaah experience, assistance from the concierge, everything was perfect and yet so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Another 1 for the Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Maximum P
Reviews.Content: The numbers should speak for itself. Fantastic hotel and probably the best service I've ever received from a hotel. It was the little things that stood out from the staff greeting you and remembering your name to the complimentary Voss water and chocolate platter within seconds of putting the bags down in the room. What stood out was the SERVICE SERVICE SERVICE! Checked in as a Visa Signature/Infinite member and got all my benefits without hesitation including the upgrade and late checkout! The room was fantastic! The ceiling to floor water to tub feature was awesome! The ONE thing I did not like was the large bottles of soaps/shampoo/lotions that would be topped up and shared from guest to guest in each bathroom. I understand this concept for a gym or spa setting but not for each room! I would prefer the individual bottles and bars. Small detail. You won't be dissapointed! Read the reviews and see for yourself. At the time of writing there were only 18 reviews 2 stars or lower. 18/494! Small details from them! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 is a very modern, comfortable, and extremely well-run hotel. I've stayed there more than 10 times and have always had an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Hotel 1000”
Reviews.Author: Valerie M
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Denny, Hotel 1000's manager, my husband and I enjoyed a waterfront view room for the two nights we spent in Seattle last weekend. The staff was solicitious and helpful at every turn, from recommending lunch and dinner restaurants, to directions to the wedding we were attending, to additional creamer in our room. Max quickly and capably drove us to and from our restaurant of choice for dinner. The quiet luxury of the hotel was fabulous, the bathtub a solace! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wow. NICE! 1st class all the way.”
Reviews.Author: spendoctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in downtown, close to everything SAM, Pike Place Mkt. I was staying there for a business conference the hotel was also hosting so got to see PLENTY of their service and food. Hotel staff are exceptional; always looking to be of assistance. The room was incredible. I had waterfront view, very nice. Everything was spotless...I can find nothing to suggest for how to improve this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's View - Gimmicks Make it Fun”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
Reviews.Content: Just off the entrance is the hotel’s Studio 1000, a lobby-slash-family room featuring a huge modern open fireplace I immediately coveted for our own home. I couldn’t help but try my hand at a few games I’d never seen on the Microsoft Surface touch screen table while I warmed up from the wet Seattle weather. ROOMS The rooms at Hotel 1000 range from 390 square-feet to the 2,000 square-foot Grand Suite. Every room has another distinctive touch – a unique pedestal bathtub that fills from the ceiling. As cool as that is, what is a bathtub without a rubber ducky? Clearly this hotel thinks like I do because one was waiting for me, perched on the side of the impressive tub! Each room is equipped with a coffee maker (although why not take full advantage of the delicious coffee steps away in any direction? This is Seattle!). The modern slate blue and rust room décor goes the extra mile with beds bejeweled in Thai linens and down pillows. In addition, most lights are dimmable. Finally! The rooms and suites feel like downtown apartments. Although the design elements are consistent throughout the hotel, the ambiance in each room is personal. I could easily imagine coming home to a suite like the ones in this hotel after a day spent at the famous Public Market. BEYOND THE ROOMS I am not a golfer, but I know fun when I see it. Downstairs from the lobby is The Golf Club, a “state-of-the-art virtual golf” room with two stations. The golfer stands on turf and lets the ball fly onto a floor-to-ceiling fabric screen that mimics a course. Depending on how the ball hits the screen, the score is tallied. I can honestly say it is the best game of golf I’ve ever played. DINING My husband and I dined in Boka, Hotel 1000’s in-house restaurant, for breakfast the morning after we checked-in. Our server brought us a complimentary basket of pastries that made waiting for the food a pleasure. There are two entrances to Boka, one from the hotel’s lobby and one from the street. MY RECOMMENDATION Book your room! Hotel 1000 is a great find. The boutique look and residential feel as well as the unique amenities put it on my top of Seattle list. My husband and I have a YouTube channel where we showcase our luxury hotel video reviews. Visit TravelbyLori.com to see them. Search "Lori Metze" at Examiner.com to see my other written hotel reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Babymoon (at least that's what they called it)”
Reviews.Author: carlo226
Reviews.Content: So far this was the best hotel experience I've had in the world. From the check in to the late check out, Hotel 1000 definitely deserved the 5 stars. My wife and I stayed here after booking their Case of the Mondays package. We got an upgrade, free in room movie, unlimited valet, and breakfast at BOKA Lounge. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. I felt as if I was in a really posh hotel from the attentiveness. They even left a card with a plate of fruit, congratulating us on our babymoon. I guess its since they saw that my wife was about to pop our little one out any day now. Out of all the amenities my wife loved the bathtub more than anything. The rooms reminded me of Hotel Unique in Sao Paulo but a lot better. Good location and within walking distance to Pikes Place Market. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salil S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well appointed, very clean, with great service. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Feb”
Reviews.Author: JCalalang
Reviews.Content: Our room was amazing, but beyond that one point there really were a 1000, the service was great, from the front desk being there for late checkin, to the quick service or the bell hop going out of his way for a power cord for our cell phone, this place had it all. The food for room service breakfast was early and every bit as great as the restaurant, (which you should try the truffle fries). The event planner for the hotel was great, she knew exactly what we wanted only after a single conversation and had everything perfect. We will be back every year for our anniversary, as well as any other event. J. Calalang

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tub”
Reviews.Author: Tarrega
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It is exactly what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The service is great. The room was amazing. Tip, stop at lush in westlake center and pick up a bath bomb and wait till dark and turn out the lights and get in the tub and look out over the city. I had an amazing time. Only Con: parking in downtown seattle has become a war zone. The city has figured out that it is an ATM for them to write parking tickets. They recently extended the street meter hours to 8pm. There is a fleet of tow trucks "prowling" around town. It's obscene. Having said that, is it really fair for hotel 1000 to charge so much for parking? I think not. Bad! $40?!! really?!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Sean60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is up to par with some 5 star hotels. The staff, from door man to maid service, was always friendly and were eager to talk share stories. The room was quiet and well appointed....very up to date and with a great view of the harbor. They even supplied a coffee press for free in room Starbucks coffee. Umbrellas are supplied and it only took a matter of minutes for the valet to bring our car up and have it ready for us when we walked out the door. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. And, this hotel is within walking distance of many city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buggiewmn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used the hotelstonight app and got a great deal on our room. I had heard a lot of great things about the Hotel 1000 from friends as we live in the greater Seattle area. And it lived up to the hype. We were greatest cheerfully by the valet driver and ushered inside. It's stunning! Awesome lighting and decor. We checked in with another friendly staff member and got complementary champagne. Our room was large with two queen beds. It had an awesome bathroom with glass looking out on the bedroom, a great freestanding bathtub with water spout on the ceiling. The bed was very comfortable and the decor again was beautiful. We had a great stay abd look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaeB0341
Reviews.Content: Calling mine and my girlfriend's stay at this hotel "excellent" or "awesome", I think would be an insult to the hotel! I don't have the vanacular to truly describe how amazing our stay was. From the staff, to the room, to just the overall experience was all more than I expected! I booked this hotel while in Iraq as an early Valentine's celebration, I was immediately contacted by one of the staff members, she helped me plan a full day of spa, and a few other things. I was a little apprehensive at first because I wasn't sure if it was going to be worth the price... Let me tell you it was worth every penny!!! The level of service was top notch! The staff was always so willing to help, they went out of their way to be of service. BOKA was awesome! The staff there was helpful, very nice, and the food was awesome! And the room... So beautiful!!! It was exacty what I expected! The Spa was... I don't know, I can't think of anything better besides amazing! I surprised my girlfriend with a full day of spa treatments, she loved it, and the hotel and the staff once again went above and beyond for us! I can't thank them enough for making our stay so wonderful! If you want a romantic pampered time with your special someone, check this hotel out!! You'd be crazy not to!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevinprin
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at the Hotel 1000. Large rooms, good service by all of the friendly staff. Good location, easy walk to Pioneer Square, downtown, Pike's Market and several very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't do better if you tried.”
Reviews.Author: eyebehold
Reviews.Content: I knew this would be a great experience when a good friend that I have a great amount of respect for, recommended this location. I had a terribly long and busy week, but this hotel was so great, it made me relax and put a smile on my face. Every aspect about it was amazing. The bed was perfect, the Television was clear and worked quickly, which I can't say about many hotels. The decorations were great, I loved the art on the walls. Design couldn't be better, neither could the soaps and toiletries. I can't rave enough about how much I loved this location. Even the hotel restaurant was amazing. I ordered the chicken and waffles, Mac and Cheese, three cocktails, and paid less than I did at my last hotel for a Philly Cheese steak and a coke! The prices were amazing, almost as amazing as the food and drinks. But I will say that the drinks are either on the Tart or Sweet side. Every time I was told a drink was not too sweet or too sour, I felt that it was. My only other qualm, was that my room key was deactivated before I had departed and the woman I called on the phone at the concierge desk (not front desk), was not very friendly, so I went to the front desk and they were happy to help me. If you love your technology, fine art, great sleep, and the ability to impress your guests, this would be the place. Any husbands out there who are looking for something romantic to do for Valentines day, take your wife here for food and drinks, then head up to your room. Guarantee she will fall deeper in love with you. Anytime I find myself back in Seattle, I will be staying here. It's a short walk away from Pike Market, has a great staff, and the fact that there is a technology hub in the rooms with USB chargers, A/V , HDMI, and component ports is incredible. Now stop reading this post and go book your room before they are fully booked if the aren't already for the next 50 years.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed in Every Aspect”
Reviews.Author: Chiefmountaineer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after returning from Alaskan cruise. We loved the hotel's location, the lobby, and certainly the room. Staff left candies and wine as we were celebrating our honeymoon. The modern decor was beautiful. The staff was the consummate example of true Customer Service. Cannot praise the staff enough regarding our treatment. Cannot wait to enjoy a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Kimmzy
Reviews.Content: Whether you are staying for pleasure or business, Hotel 1000 is a fantastic place. The employees provided wonderful service. It was quite apparent, the success of the hotel is based on how the employees are treated and in turn how well the guests are treated. The rooms are nicely furnished and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajghia
Reviews.Content: Remarkable hotel with dazzling room design. Beautiful bathroom. Excellent service. Quiet, clean and a great location. Perfect for Pike's Market. It is located off a street with a relatively steep incline if that matters. We loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Modern décor, great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: erdocmdca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 1000 for two nights last week. The hotel is recently renovated and new, so the décor is comfortable, modern, and interesting. It’s four blocks from Pike Market. The art in the room was tasteful and high caliber – spotlighted wall original paintings, objets over the coffee bar and on the bathroom shelf. The bathrobes provided were spa quality with heavy terry linings and fine cotton shells. The in-room coffee service consisted of a water kettle and press coffee service; you have to ask for decaf, though. Free internet service (as I believe should be standard for all upscale hotels)! Big, thick white cotton towels – plenty of them. Lots of storage – drawers in a dresser and shelves in the closet. The bathtub set-up is unique and well-represented in the review pictures. The room service food arrived promptly, was hot and high quality; AND it wasn’t terribly expensive. Baku, one of the onsite restaurants, was excellent – they have a full menu and a full page of tapas-size small portion plates. I had grilled octopus and fried cheese grits. The curtains made the room very dark and quiet; wonderful sleep quality; high quality sheets as well. What puts it over the top is the attention to service. The front desk answered promptly each time I called and responded to every request. When I retrieved my car from valet parking, they put fresh bottles of water in the front, offered directions, and held out the seatbelt to make seating easier – the parking staff was obviously very well trained on service. Two minor flaws: 1. Wall-mounted bath amenities (although there was bar soap) – some of my friends prefer this variation as it’s more environmentally sounds, but I like individual bottles; 2. I went to read in the library or the living room next to the entrance on my second night and all the common rooms were booked for a private event. I will definitely stay here the next time I’m in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: LynseyB3
Reviews.Content: My aunt and i went to see my little sister who is studying at UW. We just drove up from California for a few days in a rental because we flew back. From the moment they opened the car door the service was amazing, subtle, not over done but we never went without. The location is good with the train only a few blocks away. and the waterfront also a few short blocks, from here you can also catch ferries. Pikes is also within walking distance. So you have it all! The room was wonderful had everything we needed plus the beds were AMAZING almost didn't want to leave the room, and the interesting bathroom that you have to see for your self, even if you don't take a bath make sure to turn it on for a surprise. I had to convince my aunt to stay here because she likes to be cheap (although it is not expensive for what you get) she of course had to tell me that she should always listen to me. As far as i am conceded you should enjoy you whole trip even if your not in the room much. treat yourself to this amazing service, and it is Seattle so chances are you will want some relief from the rain!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller772012
Reviews.Content: Recently my boyfriend and I travelled down to Seattle for his birthday. We travel quite frequently there and always stay at the Sheraton. This time we booked at Hotel 1000 and there was no comparison. The service was oustanding - champage upon arrival, beautiful decor, a birthday card for my boyfriend, dinner reservations at an incredible resturant, and a town car that was available to take us to dinner. We could not have been more pleased with our stay and we look to visiting again soon.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bonvivant212
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business to seattle. I arranged for a room with a king size bed. The bathroom was huge, big tub which fills from the ceiling. The bed was comfortable. The location was excellent, walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “modern, comfortable, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Angela062
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early 2011, and I'm just getting around to writing this review. We had a wonderful time. The hotel is so unique in its modern look and amenities. We loved the bathtub, which fills from the ceiling, and the virtual golf course on the ground floor. My husband enjoyed playing there after we got back from dinner one night! The service was also top-notch, and it's in an excellent location, within walking distance to the market, etc. If you're in Seattle, try to get to the Dahlia Lounge, which we thought was a fantastic restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 Seattle”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel419
Reviews.Content: Don't look any further just stay at Hotel 1000. The rooms are exquisite, the location is right in the heart of downtown near Pioneer Square and Pikes Market and the service is unbelievably fantastic. Boka restaurant is outstanding! It is located in the hotel. The food was so delicious that I ate there each evening and had friends and colleagues join me on different nights. They all wanted to go to Boka too.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle's Hotel 1000!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here on special occaisons and absolutely love it! From the moment we walk in we are recognized and treated so special. Love the champagne offered when we check in! The rooms are amazing, beauifully furnished and VERY comfortable. The lobby is gorgeous and Boka the restaurant on floor 1 has amazing food, a great happy hour and friendly service. a+++++ for Hotel 1000

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Ray C
Reviews.Content: I was originally recommended Hotel1000 last year by my co-workers so I looked it up online and it definitely looked nice from the website. When I arrived, I was not disappointed. As I approached the hotel and entered, from the staff that greeted me and opened the door, to the concierge, to the check in staff, everybody was friendly and professional. The ambience of the hotel, albeit with a no-nonsense lobby area, is crisp and trendy. There's a side room connected to the lobby with the large, modern fireplace for a cozy area to relax out of the cold. Again, the Hotel1000 staff is always pleasant, clean, and prompt to see if they can be of any service to me. They don't wait for me to approach them, which is great and shows an attention to service. The staff does seem to be on the younger side, but don't count that as a negative. They bring their energy without losing any courteousness. Since that first visit, I've stayed here a number of times. A couple times I was upgraded to a suite, without me asking if one was available. They have a firm understanding that all guests should be treated well, but they also have a great understanding that repeat guests should be made to feel extra special. This is good business and also really builds the relationship and loyalty. All of the rooms I've stayed in were nice, clean, and spacious. Good, classy decorations are used and the walls and furniture have a calm, warm color palette (no gaudy or dingy furniture here). The layouts of the rooms are open. The tubs with the ceiling spouts are an interesting feature. The only small complaint I might say is there needs to be more room lighting for after the sun goes down, BUT I would say this about all hotels. I just like it bright. To be fair, these rooms are some of the brighter ones I've stayed at for hotels. The BOKA restaurant attached to the hotel is a great place to eat when you don't want to head out to find another restaurant. Breakfast is particularly good, especially with the complementary bread basket. I would say it would be nice to have a larger selection of entrees (but maybe that's because I've eaten there so many times), but overall not a bad array of choices. As mentioned, whenever I have visited Seattle I have stayed at this hotel, and the one time I didn't was because the hotel was all booked. Bummer. The other hotel I stayed at, definitely not as good as Hotel1000.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: nextmike
Reviews.Content: So the hotel has all the hipness and pizazz you'd expect from a trendy big city hotel. Fake snow falling over the front entrance, 2 full size golf simulators, chic restaurant, cool but gimmicky bath spout coming out of the ceiling. Really, there's not much not to like about it...except there's a certain 'je ne sai quoi" about the place.... Specifically, while the floor staff was friendly, I got the feeling they were all a bit too passive when given the opportunity to go the extra mile, from getting a towncar to helping find a park for my dog. My take is that the staff is just a bit too green (mostly young kids) and could use more training to get them to a '5 star' service level. Again, not bad...but not great either. Also, while the french press is nice, Hotel 1000 should step it up a bit and upgrade the Starbucks bag of coffee for some local beans. As a bonus, the hotel is dog friendly, providing complimentary dog bed, biscuits, dog bowls and toy. But they surprisingly don't have any ready to go dog walking service (I'd expect this for a top of the line hotel in a big city). As a result, the overall experience felt a bit "cold", sort of like a typical W Hotel stay. Would I go back? Maybe, but I think I'll try some other dog friendly options in Seattle first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: We decided on Hotel 1000 to celebrate my 40th birthday and it certainly was the best decision. The hotel amenities were great and the staff was sooooo attentive. Everyone from the front desk staff to the bell hop wished me a happy birthday. The hotel was in a great location near old downtown Seattle and just a couple of blocks from the pier and a few more blocks to Pike Place. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: 671StrollPatrol
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, the location is awesome you don't really need to use your car because you are so close to everything like pikes place and the Seattle public library. The restaraunt is also great, try out the boka burger. The only gripe I have with the service is on check in the front desk attendant was very short with me, like she had something else better to do than check us in, but the rest of the staff was great. I'd go back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Casual Chic”
Reviews.Author: gem6181
Reviews.Content: This place was super cool from the location to the service to the rooms. It was luxurious yet casual and cozy yet modern. We were greeted with champagne and very helpful and friendly staff. Good views of the city from the top rooms and a short walk to the water and Pike Market. The rooms were very modern, comfy bed and very clean. Didn't eat here, but the food looked good from what I saw. The gym was small but sufficient and the spa looked very nice as well. I couldn't ask for

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: They really thought it through with this place. Everything I could have asked for in a room was at my fingertips. I travel a lot and stay in many lovely hotels. At the Hotel 1000 I found a completely comfortable, lovely room with a kind of fabulous bathroom. The staff was extremely helpful as well as friendly. There was no attitude other than ' how can we make your stay as pleasant as possible?' I love that they had free internet service as well as phone calls in the US. The freestanding tub was elegant. The room was quiet - a major plus. I recommend this place1000%!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Melanie S
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, and all the amenities without feeling too big. Very clean rooms, gorgeous bathroom, french press and electric hot water pot in the room -- a nice touch. We've stayed in several hotels in downtown Seattle, and this was our favorite. Just two blocks from the water, a short walk to Pikes Market. Thanks to the great staff for a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: pedi-dent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first visit to Seattle just a couple of days before Christmas. I booked here after reading reviews. We were not disappointed. We were greeted with 2 glasses of prosecco upon arrival. Valet (Miles) took care of our luggage, showed us all room features, and answered any question we had. He brought us ice, iPod cables and two complimentary local microbrews as a welcome to the northwest. He even left a handwritten welcome note for us. Concierge Ben and Matty(?) made several reservations for us. They were both extremely pleasant and patient with us (we made a couple of changes), always made us feel that they were there to help us. Same experience in the hotel bar and restaurant, very pleasant staff. We had dinner, drinks and breakfast at Boka, I normally avoid the hotel restaurant. Seattle has great food choices. We enjoyed our 4 day stay and Hotel 1000 was a large part of that. When we come back we will definitely look to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've experienced!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiRx
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and stepped out of the car to the moment we left, everything far exceeded expectations. We had stayed at the W on a previous trip and it was, well, the W...We wanted to try something different so we went for Hotel 1000. This hotel had bigger and nicer rooms, amazing and unique bathtub with a great view, more personality and most importantly incredible gestures of hospitality and costumer service. It's not just another cookie cutter hotel and they do little things to make your stay memorable. Just a few examples: the front desk greeted us knowing our names and knowing that we were there for an anniversary right off the bat. So after greeting us with champagne and a red rose, they upgraded us to a higher level, corner room with a beautiful view. But wait there's more: when we arrived at the room, there was a congratulatory, hand written card from the manager with chocolate truffles waiting on the desk. Such a sweet gesture and a great personal touch. The TV system was awesome and had different music/scene options to set the mood. Another plus is the complementary caddy which took us to where we needed to go so we didn't have to walk or drive or get a cab if we didn't want to. The hotel itself is clean and beautiful. We ate at the restaurant on two occasions and the food/drinks were good. The location was perfect. Close to everything and within walking distance to the library, pike, and the waterfront. I highly recommend this hotel and only wish every city had a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, classy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kaylamark
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful - inside and out. The valet parkers are friendly (although it did take awhile), and so was the front staff. It is very close to Pikes place and offers varying views. We chose this one mostly because of the bathroom- huge tub with the faucet coming from the ceiling, with a glass wall that features an automatic blind, and a separate shower. It was clean and comforting. The beds are comfy, but not anything amazing. There is no continental breakfast, you have to pay for it, but the restaurant has high level ingredients and a sophisticated menu. We felt out of place slightly since we are younger, and not were not attending for business, but still felt okay going there.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: mrg128
Reviews.Content: Great service sums up our stay at Hotel 1000 - that's exactly what we received. The rooms and the hotel are nice enough, with comfortable beds, excellent TV and service, the oft cited tubs are fantastic, etc - but the service was the difference. Our flight to Seattle arrived early and we got to the hotel at 11:00 am knowing well it was too early to check in. We decided to just ask if we could leave our bags and come back later. The from desk went above above and beyond by suggesting, before I could even say anything, that we leave the bags and give them our cell number so they could call when a room was ready. She promised to try to make one available right away, and gave us the name of a good restaurant. Off to lunch we went and an hour later my cell rang with the news that we could check in early. Perfect service, in my opinion. Other staff members took care of us as well- concierge, bell desk out front, even the maid staff who took extra time to make us feel comfortable- really, it was just the way a boutique hotel should treat a customer, and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: travelin45
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beds comfortable, food from the restaurant Boka is not value for money very small portions with a big price.

Reviews.Title: “Always absolutely top notch!”
Reviews.Author: JHarris_9
Reviews.Content: If you want to go somewhere where you will enjoy simple elegance done excellently, take a trip here! I've been here about 4-5 times over the last few years. The consistent attention to detail is always present. The linens are lovely, the beds comfortable. When you arrive there's a glass of champagne to start your get-away. The bath is amazing and fills from the ceiling...the rubber duckie is a novel addition. It's close to Pike Market and the centre of Seattle. All the staff are polite and attentive without being overbearing. I checked out the gym, looks really quite decent. I like the Starbucks coffee too. I've been to Boka for breakfast on my last few trips and it's been excellent...dinner was also superb and we enjoyed the trout and salmon....both very good. On leaving, bottled water is placed in the car...a nice classy touch. Friends and family alike have enjoyed this hotel...it's not cheap but it's a real treat! On a special birthday, the management of the hotel send up a special dessert...once again...well thought out....keep up the great work at the hotel 1000....a real credit to the staff and management :)

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaomiJonesT
Reviews.Content: wehotel we have stayed at Hotel 1000 twice. Rooms are a nice size for a boutique hotel. Very hip with a large soaking tub for two. water for the tub comes out the ceiling straight into the tub. Beds are comfortable, room decorated in a dark mode type decor. I did the Spa this time and the Pedicure was wonderful. Staff went out of their way to be helpful. I forgot to wrap a couple presents and the Conciere brought up wrapping paper, tape, and ribbon and offered the wrap them for me. Consistently great and we love coming back. Food is average, could improve a bit there is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Very great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stanley G
Reviews.Content: Liked staying here with my wife. Loved the decor and everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by this gem”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Very nice, large, and modern room. Have stayed at Westin and this room was 10x better. Location isn't bad and well worth the cash.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving In Seattle: Hotel 1000”
Reviews.Author: wkcdwkcd
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Seattle to visit family during the Thanksgiving week. My experience with Thanksgiving travel over the years has been hit or miss at hotels, especially in the Seattle area. This was my first stay at Hotel 1000, it was outstanding, and I highly recommend the facility for work or pleasure stay. It is a boutique hotel that has the perfectly balanced feel of a small hotel with all the benefits of a large resort. The staff was perfect -- there when you needed them, but not intrusive. Erika, who checked me in at the front desk, passed my family at Pike Place Market later in the week, she with her kids, me with my son and nephew. She recognized us and remembered our name, saying hello. Amazing. From the front desk to the cleaning staff to the valet car parkers, everyone was pleasant and ready to assist. The hotel is a perfect location, a short walk to Pike Place Market, as well as all the downtown restaurantss and sites. And getting to and from the hotel, via I-5, was a breeze. I am directionally challenged, and hotel access was perfect. Reminiscent of my stay at the Mandarin Oriental in New York, but a significantly better value. Recommended without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jyulaws
Reviews.Content: Our group had a great experience with this hotel. Great service, very clean, comfortable, quiet and in a central location. I left my camera behind and they informed me of this and are helping send it back. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveler1_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get married at Hotel 1000 in June of 2010. Throughout the process the hotel was amazing to work with. The day went off without a hitch. The food was great, the place was beautiful and the facility perfect for around 100 people. On our wedding night we were given a huge suite, it was an upgrade from the normal suite offered, and it was amazing. On our first anniversary we went back for a stay. We had a normal room and still loved it. The rooms are so modern and have great features (like the bathtub overlooking the room and facet from the ceiling). The staff was amazing again and gave us chocolates to celebrate. I've recommended Hotel 1000 to tons of people since.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, but it was the people who made the difference!”
Reviews.Author: PNWtravelerSeattle
Reviews.Content: To celebrate a special birthday, I booked a room at Hotel 1000 for a night out of the house, and the experience far exceeded our expectations. The hotel and rooms are really quite spectacular, modern, crisp, luxurious, and the free standing tubs are very romantic. But it was the Hotel staff that really made the difference. Every interaction we had was friendly, attentive, and made us feel like our experience at the hotel was their number 1 concern. Starting with the check-in, both of the desk staff were wonderful, and went out of their way, to make my wife's birthday celebration special. They greeted us with champagne and a rose for my wife, and upgraded us to a water view room. I booked time at the Golf Club, a virtual golfing experience at the Hotel. It was fantastic, and I would highly recommend it to anyone. The manager introduced us to the experience, how to use it, and turned us loose. I got to play St Andrews with my wife! While playing, we had very attentive service from the onsite restaurant, Boka, enjoying a cold adult beverages, and a very tasty gourmet pretzel / hot dog bites. The rooms are spectacular and romantic. If your plans are to be out and about, and you just want a room for a few hours of shut eye, please, book a room somewhere else to free up a room for someone else :) From the BoKa, to the Golf Club, to the rooms. and most importantly, the wonderful people at Hotel 1000, this is truly a destination of its own, and you should plan on making time to fully appreciate and enjoy the retreat from daily hustle and pace of life. I'm a SPG platinum member, and usually stay at a SPG property, but when looking for a place to get way in Seattle, I have a new favorite. I look forward to my next excuse to stay at Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is overrated on trip advisor.”
Reviews.Author: Renffoh
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute vacation to seattle and stayed at the Hotel 1000 based upon trip advisor reviews, online photos (the rooms looked cool), and its location. I was dissapointed in the value of the hotel. I made the decision to pay extra to upgrade my room two levels, from The basic room to the grand luxe corner suite. Staff: C- Check-in was nothing more than average. Front desk staff was pleasant but no more friendly than a holiday inn or embassy suites staff. I am low maintance and dont usually need much help from staff or concierge. I wasn't greeted by any staff throughout the stay, not even bell man. I asked at check-out if she could arrange for a cab to pick me up, and she hesitated to help me. She told me taxis are driving by non stop so It's easy to get a cab. I had issues with my room at check-in, and the employee told me to stop by tomorrow and the manager could put me on higher floor (I didnt really care what floor I was on). The staff at the Boca bar was really nice, epecially the bartenders. Room: B Overall the room was nice, but not nice enough for what I paid. Since I paid extra to upgrade, I expected a little nicer view or slightly larger room. My bathroom didn't have the cool bath tubs (with water from ceiling), the view was not great from 7th floor. The view from my window was an empty office building and a bunch of heating and ac vents. My bathroom didnt even have an enclosed shower or toilet. My bathroom had a gross shower curtain, it seemed odd. I could barely fit in it it was so small. The floor to ceiling windows were really nice. The beds werent really soft. The room overall (except the shower curtain) was very clean, otherwise I would rate this room lower. Location: b+ The hotel is within a short walking distance of everywhere you need to go downtown. The hotel is located right next to a 24-7 porn shop called taboo. It seemed out of place. The other downtown hotels look slightly closer to the shopping areas. The hotel has a star bucks across the street which was nice. Spa/pool: no review Restaurant: I didnt eat at the restaurant or order room service. The bar was nice and the staff was friendly here. Other issues: I requested a different room when I checked in, hoping for a different bathroom or better view. Again, I only made this request because I paid more to upgrade (but it didn seem like I had an upgraded room). So I went from 7th floor to 10th floor to a different room. The room looked like a dungeon with no view in corner of building. I ended up going back to my original room. Overall value: C+ Overall, for the price I paid I wish I would have stayed somewhere else. The only positives were champagne at check-in, panoramic windows, free wifi and an easy walk to shopping and market. I could have stayed at the 4 seasons or another nice hotel for this price range. Nothing stood out for me, and I have no idea how others claimed to have exceptional customer service. The management needs to take a look at improving its customer service. Before I checked in I attempted to contact the hotel twice, with no response to my voice mails. I told them at check-in it was strange, but the staff shrugged it off. This was the vibe I got from the staff, not rude, they just didnt really care... (sorry for typos I'm using ipad)

Reviews.Title: “5-star service and location with great rates”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: Compare the cost of the Hotel 1000 versus the Four Seasons in Seattle and it's an easy choice. You give up the pool and hot tub but save a boatload of money. Concierge - I can't say enough about Matty and Ben - great help setting up our trip ahead of time and they were always there to make adjustments as needed during the trip too. Matty was great working with me to plan our family vacation and was excellent communicating over email. Once we got to the hotel, they were extremely helpful. The rooms were large, clean, and well designed.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect way to spend a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: wanderwhites4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with Hotel 1000 for our 20th anniversary for one night, and what a fabulous night! When I made the reservation, I mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary. We had hoped to have a special night and the folks at Hotel 1000 went out of their way to make it special! The parking valet greeted us at the curb, and once he took our name and made the connection, wished us a happy anniversary and offered us the use of the hotel's courtesy car for the evening. As we moved into the lobby, the clerk behind the desk also wished us a happy anniversary and presented us with a glass of sparkling wine and a rose. We were offered a room with a view of the harbor and every courtesy was extended. The room was beautiful, modern, sleek and perfectly located. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Space and Details”
Reviews.Author: Diana S
Reviews.Content: After the lack of customer service and space at the airport it is so refreshing to arrive at a hotel that provides an oasis. The room was large and airy but it was the 'little details' that made one feel like a home away from home. The coffee, it wasn't the instant coffee pot but a french press coffee maker. I'd never used one before but it was easy and now I have to get one for home! The many little details in the room and the bathroom (amazing) were appreciated. The staff were very pleasant and accommodating without being annoying. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing treatment for a "nobody" - place was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Christine G
Reviews.Content: I cannot compliment this staff enough - I can't wait to save enough to stay there again. I wanted to take my husband on a "stay-cay-tion" - we live literally 3 blocks from this hotel but needed some in town down time. I wanted it to be super special. And the staff 150% was behind me all the way. I arrived to champagne at the front desk upon check in - im pretty sure an across the board thing for everyone who checks in - already they had my stamp of approval. They made us reservations at their restaurant, were ridiculously kind to us and always said hi, gave us a "how are things" and brought us towels and pillows within 5 min of our requests. The restaurant even made me an item that wasnt on the menu because the waitress happened to overhear me taking about my need for comfort food during this stressful time - they made me gourmet grilled cheese and tomato soup, all with a smile and just because!!!! Do yourself a huge favor and stay here. It's my philosophy that you get what you give - all I gave them was my business and a smile, and in return this staff gave us the world! Thank you to all of you who Work there - I'm a low budget nobody who got celebrity treatment for no reason at all but that youre amazing at what you do!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: pisay p
Reviews.Content: In addition to being a frequent vacation traveler I've also worked in a hotel so I can be very particular about where I stay. My inner critic did not make a peep during my stay at the Hotel 1000. I know everyone has different expectations and needs when they travel so I'll try to be as detailed about my my experience as possible. First off, I live in Seattle. I wasn't just looking for a comfortable place to sleep. I was looking for a beautiful place to sleep in. I was lucky enough to stay in a deluxe room which had a bathroom with a walk-in shower, a jet tub and a glass wall that looked out into the bedroom. For privacy there was a remote controlled curtain. The rest of the room was laid out in a such way that didn't feel overcrowded or empty (keep in mind though I'm 5'2" and 112lbs). I loved the heavy double layer curtains that helped more with my sleeping in objective. The colors, and decor were modern but also inviting. I love walking so for me the hotel was perfectly located. If you don't like hills then Seattle may not be a city for you or you may want to consider renting a car -however valet is expensive just like every other hotel in any other city. The Hotel is on on the same street as Pioneer Square and the Pike Place Market but you have to walk 5-6 blocks up or down a slight hill depending on which direction you're going. It's about 3 blocks from the waterfront and a good 15min walk to the center of downtown where most of the bigger name clothing stores are. It has a medium size gym, a small spa, and a restaurant with great happy hour. But all of this sort of pales in comparison to the service. It's on point without being stuffy. They appreciate that you're there -and I never felt anyone make me feel like it should have been the other way around, even though I really did appreciate being there too. In particular Rachel took time to make me a special reservation for my 30th birthday and Alyssa wrote me a personal welcome back note with chocolates. I hope I get to keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BrentHouston
Reviews.Content: Frequent traveler and stay in hotels around the world. This is one of my absolute favorites. The customer service is over the top, the location is perfect and the hotel tries very hard to make it a great experience. I will never stay anywhere else in Seattle. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller boutique hotel- modern & chic”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Zure
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, nice décor, big windows- contemporary, yet warm. bathroom very roomy and lovely toiletries. Would stay there again. Concierge was so helpful and knowledgeable- his historical factoids were so interesting and as it turns out so wrong. Not one thing he told us was correct- including his “never any traffic going in that direction” when in fact, there is always traffic in that direction. Oh well. The restaurant for breakfast… menu items sounded great, but poor execution- ie everything sounded better then it tasted. The spa: The receptionist was… well, lets just say not the sharpest knife in the drawer, but no harm done. Very small, but had most everything you would need and not busy, so no problem. They offered some mini services- mini massage and facial which were quite thorough. The women who did my facial was just so nice and interesting, I really enjoyed her company and she seemed to really care about doing a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The location is great for walking and exploring downtown Seattle, and the rooms were very comfortable and luxurious. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great for fun or business”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a short business trip and the hotel was very nice. The food at the restaurant was excellent and it had a cool bar scene. What I appreciated the most though was the quality of the service. The front desk folks were genuinely friendly and helpful. The bathrooms very definitely cool. I didn't find the beds to be all that comfy but they rarely are.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AaronVancouver
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, great attention to detail. Staff was friendly, professional and attentive. Room was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: scott10s
Reviews.Content: My wife and two teenage daughters stayed at Hotel 1000 for a long weekend visit to Seattle. We have travelled extensively all over the world and have not had a better experience anywhere. I have never seen happier or more helpful staff anywhere. The front desk staff, waiters, valets, everyone. Everybody working in this hotel gave you the feeling they had the best job in the world. Oh, did I forget to mention the great location, cool decor and wonderful restaurant? Stay there. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect jumping off point for first Seattle visit”
Reviews.Author: FarmerGrrl
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle for five days on our first trip to the Northwest. As has been thoroughly covered in previous reviews, the bathroom was great with the tub that filled from the ceiling and an awesome showerhead, as well as high end toiletries. (I acutally used the shampoo and conditioner, which is unusual). They must've turned back the pressure, because the splashing when filling the tub was minimal, and they've also included small bottles of bath gel so that you don't have to get it out of the larger dispensers in the shower. The rubber duckie was a fun touch. The lighting in the rooms is superb, with most of the lights on dimmer switches. The bedding was some of the best I've encountered. We walked all over downtown Seattle, and I don't think there could have been a better location, roughly halfway between the Market and Pioneer Square. If you're driving or renting a car, be prepared, there is little overnight parking available in the area, and we ended up having to use the valet a couple of evenings when returning after many of the garages had locked up for the night (6:30pm). The valet is quick and professional, but at $40 plus tip, it's more than I'd like to spend. On the nights that we did make it into other garages, (didn't utilize valet), it cost $20 overnight. Overall, the service was great - they did a great job striking a balance between warm/friendly and professional. Definately try the restaurant (BOKA) or order room service. I'm not typically a fan of hotel restaurants, but this was top notch. (It was actually a recommendation of a local.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....great people!”
Reviews.Author: Azluvz2travel
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Perfect location for downtown Seattle. All sites and great restaurants within walking distance. Beautifully appointed rooms and the staff was so friendly. Sparkling wine at check in, great suggestions for sites and restaurants and well as a great restaurant in the lobby of the hotel. Fun and trendy yet comfortable and relaxing! Don't miss this while in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Find!”
Reviews.Author: destinationchange
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute trip to Seattle and sue to several conventions may of the hotels were sold out. I lucked out and got a reservation at Hotel 1000. Having never been to Seattle, I wasn't sure about the location or the hotel. I had delayed air travel and ended up coming in around 11pm- and had NO clue how to get to the hotel. I called the front desk and they were able to give me very easy directions. When i arrived the valet was prompt and I was upgraded upon check in to a bay view Suite. It was beautiful. The room service food was actually GREAT- it came from their restaurant Boca and was no different then dining at the actual restaurant. The bartender Michael was so friendly and was able to give me some good pointers about places to go and see in Seattle. The hotel is literally 3 blocks walking to Pike's Market (maybe 5-7 minutes) and there are shops all along the way you can go through. The hotel also offers a courtesy vehicle to drop you off at a location if you desire. I had to check out about 3:30am and the front desk was so helpful, they brought my car around, loaded my bags and sent me off with directions back to the airport. I typically stay at Four Seasons, but the Seattle location was sold out and I was truly hesitant about giving another hotel a shot- but I am so glad I did, because this is a hidden gem of a place, great prices (1/2 the price of the Four Seasons), great food, and helpful staff. If I find myself in Seattle again, I will most definitely be staying at Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “When the bath is as good as the bed”
Reviews.Author: ShaunofSingapore
Reviews.Content: I usually wait until I check out to write reviews, but so impressed am I with this hotel, I decided to do it mid-stay. This is an amazing hotel and somehow it manages to blend traditional, luxury and quirky all the same time. Our group was part of a large company gathering and our meeting was perfectly run by the hotel. Everyone was buzzing about the bedrooms, which are rather special. The bed is great, large and comfy, but for me this hotel stands out because of the bathroom. I am not sure if other reviewers give away the quirk, but I came out with a smile on my face every time I came out of the bathroom. Really smart touch that will have people talking. Some of my colleagues showed their kids the bathroom on Skype! Restaurant/ bar, BOKA is also great with good food, but I have a soft spot for the Bookstore bar across the road, so if like me you had a longer stay it's good to alternate for an after work cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, snazzy hotel that really tries hard to be excellent.”
Reviews.Author: travelling_light57
Reviews.Content: Took the opportunity to stay the last night of our trip to PNW at this hotel, which was very good to excellent on all fronts from initial booking to check-out. All the staff encountered were gracious; however, found them a bit more cool and aloof than the initial hotel we enjoyed upon arrival to Seattle. At the same time, it seemed they almost staged overboard to be perfectly ''hostful", perhaps not as genuine. The hotel is quite modern, newer, sleek, and tasteful. Lots of fun in the ceiling spout bathtub, you bet! Splashes some, but plenty of towels available to remove water, besides housekeeping comes around early evening to turn-down and tidy up with a candy or two to sweenten the deal! Honestly, more water got on the floor from the shower than the tub...looked like some leaky issues. Also, there was some grunge along the glass seal areas in several places in the shower. Were upgraded on check-in to a water view room on the tenth floor. Even the bellman thanked us for staying with them as he closed the taxi for our trip to the airport. Concierge was warmly responsive and prompt with arrangements. Did not dine at the restauraunt or go to the bar, but would try them both on a return visit whether I stayed at this hotel or another great one close-by. At least for short-term, this hotel was definitely worth a splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Low class”
Reviews.Author: Richellee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend made sure since I was arriving early that I would be able to check in before him. The girl at the front desk REFUSED to let me check into the room even though they had his credit card information and they had spoken earlier and come to agreement about my coming early (big deal - we do this all the time). She said without a credit card I was unable to enter. She said only with a huge deposit put onto my credit card could I go into the room. My card was at its max at that point and it didn't go through. She was so rude, and REFUSED letting me into the room, after a long day of traveling, luggage and all. It took a long time to speak to the manager who finally let me in my room. She purposely took her time, even rolled her eyes at me. I was flabbergasted. When we checked out we didn't receive a discount. We really wished we had stayed at the W Hotel :( Rooms decent nothing special. Bar/restaurant downstairs had decent food. All nothing special. Would never return even if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Boutique Hotel with Contemporary Flair”
Reviews.Author: tuddo
Reviews.Content: The setting near Pioneer Square was perfect for shopping, strolling and dining after our conference. The hotel has added touches that make the fairly small room ( 390 sq ft for a strandard "Luxe" room) seem extra large and functional as well as luxurious. The beds and linens are among the finest I've slept in, and the oversize tub with a waterfall fill from the ceiling, showcased in the room with a glass wall between the bathroom and the bedroom, was terrific. The restaurant has great food, and some amazing cocktails, so I suggest dining there at least one night of your stay. I liked the clean architectural lines and the contemporary feel without it seeming cold or losing the comfort one expects from a moderately-expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Ladydars
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel 1000 for one night only in July 2011. I absolutely loved it, and wished I could have stayed longer. As everyone else says - the bath was amazing! I was coming down with a cold, and the luxury of that bath made me feel a whole lot better. We lucked out with the views too - could see the water, which was just a brilliant extra. The staff were so lovely on check in and check out, and helped us when we needed directions or advice. The restaurant in downstairs was really nice - the right mix of laid back and special. To sum up - if I win the lottery, I am gonna buy me and my man tickets to Seattle, and we are staying there for at least a week!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlietheBlueJay
Reviews.Content: First the staff are very nice when you arrive. The suite was very nicely decorated and the bed comfortable with good linens. The Bathroom is fabulous. Beautiful tub and great shower with good products. Free Champagne & gift for special occasion. We had a great view from our suite on the 12th floor. Also great location for shopping and Art Galleries. We would stay here again. Good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gargoyle_A2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in September, 2011. Our tenth floor waterview room was the perfect size for us and exceptionally clean, and the view of the sound was very nice. I enjoyed watching the ferries going back and forth all day. Everyone raves about the bathrooms here, and deservedly so. They are very chic and fun. My wife used the tub every night and was able to watch the TV while she soaked. I also enjoyed sitting by the fireplace in Studio 1000. You will be four blocks from Pike Place Market and three blocks from Pioneer Square. We even walked the 11 blocks to the International area for Dim Sum, and it didn't seem like it was that far. There are other good restaurants right around the hotel. The staff here are efficient and friendly. Anything you need, they take care of it promptly. A special shout-out to Alice at the front desk. Thank you for all the great restaurant recommendations. If you're looking for a friendly boutique hotel that's in the middle of it all, Hotel 1000 is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: QueenMean
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Really. I liked the layout, the design, the beds, the bathrooms etc. While I was not as enraptured with the tub that filled from the ceiling as most seem to be (for one thing it splatters water like crazy) the tub itself was probably one of the most comfortable I've ever experienced in a hotel. Usually they are either too big or too small ( or too gross) to bathe comfortably, but this was the Goldilocks Tub, just right in terms of size. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room had everything you could ask for and more, including robes that I didn't feel squeamish putting on. We tried out the spa, and it was excellent and we had two very nice massages though the prices are a bit steep (perhaps that is the usual for Seattle but it was more than a third above what we are used to paying...I can't really compare prices due to being unfamiliar with Seattle's base price but we've had massages in almost every geographic region of the US and these were definitely among the most expensive). However, the spa was very nice. The gym was adequately equipped. The location was excellent, in easy walking distance to several local attractions and the staff was universally friendly, helpful and pleasant and we had no problems whatsoever with any of the amenities features or room service. I am dinging this hotel a single star for one specific reason, that is possibly not an issue for the weekend traveler, and I have recently decided that I am going to ding every hotel we stay at that does not provide this service: a guest operated laundry facility. When we travel, we travel for extended periods of time and we don't like to stay at flea bag hotels which appear to be the only ones that offer coin-operated laundry services any more. The upper end hotels (and even the mid-range hotels) now rely on severely over-priced laundry services that are completely ridiculous. We arrived at Hotel 1000 and we had about ten days worth of laundry to do and still a week left on our vacation--a major laundering was needed. Hotel 1000 charges $9.00 for a pair of pants to be laundered. I priced out having my laundry sent out to be cleaned and realized that the total to do my laundry would have been about $250 and that's if I sink washed socks and underclothes! If they offered a coin-operated laundry unit, I could have washed the same clothes in roughly two loads for less than $20. I found this completely ridiculous. I don't believe the extended traveler should be gouged on laundry, nor should they have to schlepp their dirty clothes to a laundromat (in this case the closest one was 2 miles away) and I don't believe it's entirely beyond the realm of space considerations to place a coin-operated laundry facility on hotel premises.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: Bill33045
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at this hotel. Have not been disappointed once. They really care. From champagne on arrival to the fresh smell upon entering your room. Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and awesome bath tub!”
Reviews.Author: DorothyLi
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location I just stayed in the Hotel 1000 from September 14 through 20th. It was amazing. The location was ideal to go to Pioneer Square, the Public Market (Pike's Market) and Downtown for shopping. It was easy to reach this hotel from the S.L.U.T (South Lake Union Transit). Excellent Service Our great stay started before we arrived. We received a pre-arrival welcome email to ask if we needed anything special. The hotel provides great service. The front desk is so helpful. We showed up and they provided champagne at check in and upgraded us to the water front room. It was AWESOME! They also gave good recommendations to restaurants. I asked for a small fridge to store my soda pop and fruit. They delivered it to my room within minutes. The room was impeccably clean. Amenities The hotel toiletries were pretty awesome. I loved the Milton Brown hand soap, shampoo and conditioner. (Note they were all installed in the shower or by the sink.) The best part was the bathtub. It was just as they show on the website. The water comes from the ceiling. The glass wall so I could watch the flat screen TV while soaking in a tub was wonderful. It's definitely an exhibitionist's delight. While the price was expensive, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good independent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: After flying 20+ hours I was greeted with champagne on arrival, a small gesture that was welcomed and appreciated. From the photos I was expecting a bit more from the decor but it is nice and the hotel has everything you'd need plus more.

Reviews.Title: “'Excellent' is the word!”
Reviews.Author: Manjeena
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for our wedding night (This was last year's (2010) summer, but I never got a chance to come back and write a review) Our stay was very very nice, we were upgraded to a suite (complimentary).
