In short, everyone at the hotel went out of their way to make our stay very pleasant and memorable. I highly recommend this hotel and would go back to stay in a heartbeat!! Thank you Hotel 1000!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: gwilsonDallas
Reviews.Content: Hip and cool Hotel that was also accommodating for our 7 and 1 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MakeMyBed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The staff is very helpful and friendly, we had a big corner room on the 14th floor with a comfortable bed and an amazing gorgeous grand bathroom! Breakfast was included and it was VERY VERY good, we took advantage of their happy hour late one night ( I believe it is from 9.30 till 11 pm) and the food was again VERY VERY good. They do have a hotel car to drive you but that car was not always available. The hotel is located in the center of town and you can walk to the famous Pike Place Market which we did. I know this is a boring review but there is nothing bad or funny to write about this hotel, just a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Girls Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: OregonSp8
Reviews.Content: 2 girlfriends and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend for a girls get away and throughly enjoyed ourselves. The room was beautiful and I especially enjoyed the over sized bath tub; what a treat! The staff was very friendly. My only dissapoinment is that the beds were not as comfortable as I'd hoped, but I am particular about beds. Happy hour at the hotel bar was excellent, try the jalapeno poppers. YUM! I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyTraveller77
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, service and location. We highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sure to impress”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were able to walk in on a Saturday evening and get booked into a Deluxe Queen room with a view of the city for just under $300. The super deep 2 person bath tub fills up with water that falls from the ceiling into the tub without splashing (thanks to ions, I guess). They also offer virtual golf, a library and a cool outdoor terrace area. Food, parking and in room sundries all incur substantial fees, so this is definitely not the penny pincher pick among Seattle hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: redoak
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Rooms are modern, spacious and comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. Location is excellent --easy walk to Pike Place Market, restaurants and downtown. Has the feel of a small hotel. Nice to feel that you are not lost in a sea of guests. And probably one of the most unique bathtubs you will find in a hotel. Not inexpensive but I think there is value for what you pay. Breakfasts are a highlight- Their version of "corn beef hash" is outstanding. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: notsofrosty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family trip and I must say, "what a great surprise!" The management must be incredibly diligent because the customer service here is one of the best I've ever experienced, and that includes stays at major 4-Star hotels like the Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton. I've never seen staff so cheerful to assist, from the front desk (thanks Alice for the great view!) to the valet, who even gave us bottled water for our road trip. We were greeted in our room with calming music and a personal note. Shortly thereafter arrived a welcome gift of freshly baked cookies and milk for the kids and gourmet cheese, breads and fruit for my husband and I. It was the perfect touch after a long day of travel. The decor is modern with a moody, sultry feel that's perfect for romantic getaways or destressing after a long business day. Even the bathroom hardware is unique! The location couldn't be more convenient. It's only a couple blocks away from art museums and Pikes Market and another couple blocks from the harbor piers. We easily walked to just about everything. I can't wait for an opportunity to stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Looking Forward to Future Stays”
Reviews.Author: msenske
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Seattle's Hotel 1000 last week and it was a great experience. The hotel was a short walk from Sound Transit's University Station, which made it a breeze to travel from Sea-Tac International Airport to the hotel via light rail. The hotel staff was incredibly friendly and welcomed me to the hotel and explained the services available to guests upon check-in. The room was absolutely fantastic with a nice view of the waterfront and Puget Sound. It was very well appointed, comfortable, and extremely clean. The bathroom had an enormous soaking tub, separate shower, and private water closet. There was ample room for getting some work done and plenty of storage for luggage and clothing. The hotel's restaurant and bar, BOKA, had a terrific menu, the food was fresh, and the service impeccable. The next time I'm in Seattle, I will definitely be returning to Hotel 1000!!!

Reviews.Title: “For our 25th Anniversry! Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: kangaroocrazy
Reviews.Content: We felt like royalty from beginning to end! From the moment we walked in,..to the day we left and they got our car,..and stocked two ice waters in for us on such a hot day. The view was amazing,..the room fabulous,..and our favorite,..the special bathtub that fills from the ceiling!! We highly recommend staying at Hotel 1000. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels anywhere!!”
Reviews.Author: kkhinnm
Reviews.Content: This place is so awesome. The rooms, the restaurant, the staff, everything!! I was floored when I walked into the room the first time and there was soft jazz playing and a collection of Masterpieces being displayed on both of the TV sets. The bathroom was huge and my wife literally spent HOURS in the bathtub, enjoying the music and the water coming out of the ceiling. Very modern so if you are looking for grandmas antiques and tea and crumpets, this is not the place for you. BOKA is a terrific restaurant with a great wine list and fabulous food. Ate here mor ethan once it was so good. Great location, just a stroll to the water and/or Pikes Place Market and the shops there. This is the hotel I choose when traveling to Seattle. They have never been less than fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: Luxurious hotel. Comfortable beds. Great bathrooms. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Any request was immediatly taken care of. Lots of fun in the virtual golf/video game room. Close to everything you want to see in Seattle. Great hotel for families. Turn down service. In the morning try the virtual checkers and free coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: krjenkins05
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service - outstanding staff - great location

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: Papergirlk
Reviews.Content: An absolute customer focus exists at the Hotel 1000 from the day you check in to the day you depart. I'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: travellerandspouse
Reviews.Content: Having travellled for business and pleasure for the past 35 years and stayed in all kinds of hotels and motels, this has been the most superior experience! Exceptional treatment. Staff at the hotel go above and beyond to give you the best customer service. The food in the restaurant is excellent as is room service. Hotel 1000 will definitely see my business again - this is the only place to stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “A Cut Above”
Reviews.Author: TexasSM
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure I stayed at the same hotel as some who have written such negative reviews. Perhaps rooms vary widely, but ours was just like pictures posted here in TripAdvisor. Everything about our room was better than the best. I even took note of the hairdryer's brand and model, hoping to find one for home. As for service, we lacked nothing from the time we arrived, and were greeted with glasses of champagne to take to our room. The location is convenient for sightseeing, not far from the airport, and our breakfast was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000? Hotel DELUXE!”
Reviews.Author: RunningDogYankee
Reviews.Content: Listen to me. I used to live in Seattle, so I know what I'm talking about. When I used to live there, I was a penniless student living in honest poverty, gazing into the street front shop windows and hotel lobbies of four star establishments. I wondered what it would be like to be rich, but thought I'd never have the chance. Twenty years later, I returned to Seattle like a prodigal son, but with some cash in my pocket. I wanted to splash out on an extravagant little holiday with my girlfriend, but not empty that pocket. I found a 4 night deal on the internet with Hotel 1000 and made my reservation. I was not disappointed. They gave us a great view of the sunset over the Olympic Mountains and only a few blocks from the waterfront. I was able to wander the streets and visit my old haunts (especially Belltown), but with a difference. I was able to return to the tasteful, low key cool of Hotel 1000, instead of a studio apartment with a Murphy bed in the wall (remember those?).. Now who was looking in? The staff were great: attentive, respectful, and sophisticated - no haggling over whether you had that extra bottle of sparkling water out of the mini-bar or not. The room was terrific with a bath to die for. The location of the hotel was perfect and within easy walking distance of shopping, great eateries, and the Pike Place Market. We ate out every night in some seafood restaurant we fancied just by passing by. For four days we lived a dream of Luxe before returning to our middle income ways. Affordable and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL SHOULD BE RATED 5 STARS”
Reviews.Author: elev121
Reviews.Content: The staff's commitment to their guests was beyond our imagination. Every employee at this hotel is wired in and able to communicate with each other instantly. No detail goes unnoticed. Between the time we pulled up to the hotel entrance and the time we arrived at the front desk everybody already knew our name (and everytime we passed an employee-well OK, almost everytime, we were recognized by using our name.) We were offered champagne, the concierge offered his assistance, the check-in clerk was efficient and more than attentive. Before you knew it we were in our room with all of our bags. I find it difficult to describe the room other than to say it left us excited to be there. We really didn't want to leave. The restaurant is located off the main lobby. We usually try to avoid hotel restaurants but this one was designed on the cutting edge and serves excellent food with the service we'd come to expect. Can't wait to return to Seattle just to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frangipaniii
Reviews.Content: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Nines - the rooms were big and spacious and they had the coolest bathtub with water coming down from the ceiling! The staff and the concierge were all very friendly and the property is centrally located within walking distance to Pike's place, Chinatown, etc.. Definitely worth going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Holy Mackerel! ( or should I say salmon )”
Reviews.Author: mbraun85
Reviews.Content: Incredible Hotel! My wife and I topped off out vacation this year with 2 nights at the Hotel 1000. I'm an airline pilot with a major 'American Airline' (get it?) and stay at a lot of international destinations. This hotel tops any place I've ever stayed. Fantastic room period! I'm not too sure that this would be such a great hotel for families because it's truly set up for couples IMHO. The over sized bathtub is a lot of fun. It has an shade that raises and lowers so if your up for a little excitement with your significant other and you've ever been to Amsterdam then I'm sure you'll get some ideas. The staff is WAY beyond any group I've dealt with. Whoever hires for this hotel needs to be commended. They truly seem to like what they do. It makes a world of difference and it shows. We wanted for nothing except to not have to leave in the morning of the second night. The prices can vary widely on particular nights so make sure you do some web searches to save some money. Bottom line: Top Notch!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel that lacked privacy and unfortunately I will not be back”
Reviews.Author: jmtolerico
Reviews.Content: Here is my honest review: PROS: The location was great, the service was fantastic, they even greeted us with champagne, it was classy, and the restaurant's food was very good. CONS: I was on a weekend retreat with a date and felt uncomfortable in the room. There was very little privacy and the bathroom left little to the imagination. I actually had to use the facilities downstairs. It seems the architecture sacrificied comfort for modern decore. The remote didnt really work and they tried to fix it but the TV was slow. Overpriced! For $500 + I expected a much better room. It was small and the luxury view wasnt all that. Not like the picture on the website. Disappointed The manager and staff was Very responsive and nice. Overall - I would have rather stayed at the four seasons or will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ak8843
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1000 for a weekend get away from Portland. We chose the hotel based on all of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor and I have to say that they did not disappoint. All of the staff we encountered were incredibly friendly and helpful. We were made to feel welcome as soon as we arrived. You can tell that they are very proud to work there and it makes all the difference. Cleanliness is very important to me and I could tell that the hotel takes this as seriously as I do. Our room was immaculate. The hallways, elevators, gym and restaurant were all exceptionally clean and well maintained. Speaking of the restaurant, the food is AMAZING. You have to have the Watermelon Salad and the Mac & Cheese. The hotels location is perfect with easy access to anywhere you need to go, especially Pike Place Market. Between the staff, food, location and the general quality of the product, the value is execeptional. You can't go wrong with this hotel. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS ALL OVER THE PLACE STAY AWAY GO SOMEWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: TzungChung
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel, for 2 nights, we noticed the problem the first night and we reported it to the managment, they told us they were going to investigate and they take things really seriously, however nobody called me back the next day, and they told us they would charge us for early departure if we decided to leave, so we decided to stay but we change rooms, the second room on the 8th floor was even worst, you can feel the bed bugs walking on your legs at night, it's horrible, we again reported it to the managment and they offered us free breakfast!! really, free breakfast for 2 nights of bed bugs infestation. Really nice room but really need to do something about this problem, in the meantime I am reporting this to every site I can, there are two cases open on Bedbug registry and the Bedbug report,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room & amazing service”
Reviews.Author: StaySaneInCrazyTimes
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel 1000 for a two night last stop of a 3 week family trip. The location was perfect - five blocks to Pike's Market, a couple blocks to the harbor. The beauty and comfort of the room blew us away. The elegance of the bathroom must be seen to be believed. But even better yet was the service. Hotel staff went way above and beyond what would have been expected. Everyone who worked there made it seem like they loved being there and were delighted to be there to help you. When we arrived, my husband was sick and by 3 a.m. it was clear he needed to see a doctor. Hotel staff gave us the names & numbers for the local hospitals and then called each for us to find out which one had the shortest ER wait. Shortly before we were to check out, I slid on a metal grate on the sidewalk in front of the hotel and went down hard on my knee. A hotel staffer saw it happen. He followed us to the room with a bag of ice to address any swelling. Then and returned with a bottle of water and some tylenol. Within an hour later, another staffer was at the door asking how I was feeling and bringing up milk & cookies to "help me feel better" along with a "heard you took a tumble, hope you are doing well" card from the manager on duty. Will we recommend Hotel 1000 to anyone we know who will be traveling to Seattle? Absolutely! Sure, it may be a little pricier than some of the other choices available, but it is well worth every dime you pay.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday party”
Reviews.Author: grapewizard
Reviews.Content: We chose a grand luxe parlor suite, which was a corner overlooking downtown, but still enough views of the water. Great size suite, awesome bathroom, great toiletries. $549+++. Staff was great. Location good, if you don't mind being away from Pike's Market, but you're still downtown. Restaurant was fair. Food was fair. Monday half-price wine list is very good value and selection. Service was good. Overall, I would stay there again, but probably save $ by dropping the room category a notch or two.

Reviews.Title: “Love Seattle & the Finer things in Life? No car?... No problem!”
Reviews.Author: AngelenoTraveler
Reviews.Content: My Guy & I flew in for a 4 day holiday and tour of Seattle to celebrate my Birthday. We didn't want to have the hassle of renting a car, so we chose a rather centrally located Hotel. We also have a tendency to enjoy a rather hip but cushy sort of hotel, and since Hotel 1000 came up as a Favourite, we went for it. The rooms were perfect, the decor modern but not so much that it was minimalist or not user-friendly. I particularly liked the television feature of being able to sit back, relax and watch a stunning slideshow of photographs from around the world while listening to music. The Staff were incredibly helpful with suggestions (restaurants, sights, etc) and they were appreciative of our car-less status. The Concierge was quick to get us a taxi if need be, or show us walking directions on the map. And honestly, you really can do downtown Seattle some justice without the expense of a rental car. I also particularly loved the Bathroom amenities and the Molton Brown Toiletries. This was a Bath Lovers Paradise! The tub was enormous (big enough for two, if you like) and separate from the shower which was located on the opposite side of the bathroom. The tub also fills from a spout located in the ceiling which looks pretty neat, but takes away from the peaceful “Oh let me just warm this bath up a bit” option. It should also be noted that there is no privacy unless you roll down the Blind as the bathroom wall connected to the living room is actually a window and not a wall at all. Our room was clearly for Couples, and not Business Associates. My only complaint would be the fact that the Shower did splash a bit out onto the floor, since it is all the same level with no divider. But other than that, feel free to Sleep, Bathe, and Relax Away at Hotel 1000. And if you travel like we did, you'll need the respite after a long day of hoofing around downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend get away!”
Reviews.Author: mojostillhotel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really cool and modern. Loved the bath tub and the view of the ferry boats. walking distance to the waterfront and Pike place market. The staff was beyond helpful and friendly. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “tops our list for great location, service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: jeremc1
Reviews.Content: Our room was roomy, with great windows overlooking the city. The location is perfect, we walked everywhere. The housekeeping staff provided prompt service both morning and evening......lovely chocolates with the turndown. Best of all was the concierge. He gave us excellent recommendations of things to see during the day and easy directions on how to get there, We had a great meal every evening, also with help from the concierge. who called ahead to get us a great table. On one particular evening, the hotel even provided car service to the restaurant. All in all, our 5 day stay at Hotel 1000 was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great location. Walking distance to Pike's market.”
Reviews.Author: turk24426
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Valet parked car and walked all over downtown area. Friendly staff. Nice, clean room. Expensive, but higher end place. Liked we did not have to drive. Walked to pikes market, shopping and waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: jimmymuldo
Reviews.Content: we had a beautiful room at the Hotel 1000. We got the City View rather than the sea view, but from the 11th floor the city looked great. The room was large, very nice, with a massive comfortable bed and a huge TV. The bathroom was great, with a bath next to the window looking out over the city. The tap was weird - the water came pouring from the ceiling and gave you a soaking to the back of the head if you didn't know where it was going to come from. Its in a great location for the Waterfront, and a short (but steeply uphill) walk from the cool area of Capitol Hill. The service was great but we were a bit disappointed by the breakfast that we ordered from room service. Overall we would definitely stay here again if visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel; don't think twice!!”
Reviews.Author: buddabella
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently on our engagement trip and this hotel was by far the nicest hotel of which I have ever stayed! From the moment we arrived, the staff was waiting for us, with all the proper information, and made our check in a breeze. Once we arrived in the room, it was amazing! The tv was programmed to say our name, the room was immaculate, it even had any amenity that one could need. The bathroom was fabulous with a glass wall with a shade that would rise and shut so that you could relax and enjoy a show while in the tub or close it for showing purposes. I cannot say enough about how wonderful it was. It made my vacation to stay at such a fantastic place!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it....ALOT.”
Reviews.Author: Catter57
Reviews.Content: We are in the hospitality business so it takes alot for us to be impressed...let alone write a comment on tripadvisor. From check-in to check-out we had smiles on our face. We were celebrating our 25th. Concierge handed me a beautiful rose upon check in...and we found a plate of truffles w/ a 5" white chocolate disc with 'happy 25th anniversary' written on it. View of the water...great contemporary room. The hotel car took us to our restaurant and to the train station upon departure. Everybody called us by name..even the housekeeper who provided turn down service. Concierge recommended Il Terrazo Carmine for dinner since we were looking for Italian food---wonderful old world experience. We will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed in.....after travelling the world”
Reviews.Author: GCPicnic
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel - from check in to check out. Great service - awesome rooms with great decor and home comforts. Excellent furnishings. Excellent staff - very friendly - great bar downstairs with great food and drinks. Had just finished world business tour over 5 weeks - this was the best hotel by far.

Reviews.Title: “The most attentive service ever!!”
Reviews.Author: PACNWTravlr
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Hotel 1000 our every need was anticipated. A glass of champagne at check in, truffles in our room (we were celebrating an anniversary) and bottles of water in our car when we departed were just some of the incredible touches at this wonderful hotel. The decor in this hotel is beautiful and our room was peaceful and very comfortable. The bathroom was large and very well appointed with a huge soaking tub. We enjoyed excellent food at BOKA (try the truffle fries!) and service that was above and beyond anything we have seen before. They even stored our leftovers for us. Every staff person that we interacted with was committed to our enjoyment and comfort. We have already recommended Hotel 1000 to others and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a fantastic hotel and experience!”
Reviews.Author: dbabnb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based upon the other reviews on Trip Advisor. We liked the location (close to Pike's Market ) and the pictures looked great. We checked-in late (7pm) due to our travel plans and as soon as we walked in the front desk staff asked if we were Mr &Mrs B...Whoa, cool! They then handed us 3 glasses of cold champagne as we completed our check-in. When we got to the room it was really COOL! Large entry, cool bathroom ( the stand alone tub that fills from the ceiling!!) AND a great separate shower. Bath products were first class as well! The room was larger than normal (we had 2 full beds) and it has a great VOIP phone system with messages as well as a fantastic flat screen TV. Very clean, neat and functional. The staff couldn't have been more professional. We were offered the car service when we left every day and when we needed our car it was there in a nano second, with bottles of cold water and they offered to remove all other trash that was left by us from the day before!! We had drinks at BOKA, also great and relaxed in the lounge (very interesting fireplace!). We were sad to leave but we WILL be back! You won't be disappointed by this choice as a hotel in Seattle!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing top ranked hotel”
Reviews.Author: gtbuck27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend recently and thought the hotel was amazing. It was everything that it was advertised and more; chock full of amenities, beautiful Puget Sound views, friendly and incredibly courteous staff, and walking distance to many great sites and activites.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottishexiles
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a weekend trip to Seattle and stayed at the Hotel 1000. We can say that the stay at the hotel enhanced our eperience. The room was spacious and beautiful decor. We liked the little touches like bathrobes, toiletries and even a rubber duck for the bath. While in Seattle try Wild Ginger restaurant which is within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to Close the perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Daniellask
Reviews.Content: After a long honeymoon between Napa Valley and Vancouver, we stop by Seattle for just a Day and stay in this wonderfull Hotel. Describe you the rooms is just impossible, we stay in a Junior suite and everything was perfect, elegant but not over the top, moder, beautifull, the bathroom was littleraly a dream... but the service was to dye for, starting from the bell boys that drove us to the restarant as a complementary service, continuing with the champaign glass in the front desk and finishing with the rose petals in our bed... was an excelent closure to our honeymoon. Thank you team of Hotel 1000

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 is lightyears ahead of all hotels in luxury, entertainment and class!”
Reviews.Author: DrMoto118
Reviews.Content: From the warm reception, to the amazing bed, to the chic accommodations and amenities throughout this hotel, I felt as much like I was on a vacation as I was on a business trip! The staff is professional, helpful and courteous, but it is clear that they are superbly trained and love their work. I was proud to invite business contacts to meet with me in Hotel 1000, because the impression left upon each of them was one of class and sophistication with a deep sense of style. After having stayed in many of the finer hotels in Seattle, NYC, LA, Europe, Asia and some of the finer cities in South America. I can say with confidence that this is by far my favorite hotel in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty that is also your best friend”
Reviews.Author: TDLWPDX
Reviews.Content: It's hard to know how it can be done better than what we experienced at this hotel, which will be our one and only for every Seattle stay from now on. We were treated with the kindness and warmth like a best friend, but with the detailed spoiled treatment that I assume Royalty enjoys. We've traveled a lot, including all the "top" hotels in Seattle, and have extensively traveled back East, Europe, Asia and the best of S. America and I can't say I've had a better experience than the treatment, professionalism and warmth of the staff here. The hotel was chic and spotless but the care left all the attitude that comes with this kind of environs at the curb. The king suite was luxurious, though on the small side by square footage but the use of space, the view, and all the conveniences afforded by location, an always ready to please staff, a complimentary hotel car (though it was busy one time we wanted to be driven and so took a cab), made up for the square footage shortage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lblaire
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 was absolutely fabulous! My husband is a NY Yankee fan, with a birthday at the end of May. It just so happened that the Yankees were coming to Seattle to play the weekend of his birthday, so I surprised him with Diamond Club tickets, and we flew from Mississippi to Seattle for the game. After much deliberation and endless internet comparisons, I chose to stay at Hotel 1000. I couldn't have made a better choice! We stayed three nights. The staff was extremely friendly, made recommendations for restaurants, and helped us with directions. We arranged a town car to pick us up from the airport when we flew in (through booking on the Hotel 1000 website, they allow you to do that), and they had a town car waiting to take us to the airport at 4:30 AM the morning we flew out. The room was awesome, everything was truly perfect! They even sent up chocolates for my husband with a personal happy birthday message on them. We also ordered room service at one point: the hamburger was delicious! If we ever visit Seattle again, we will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KM_JM2010
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times for business and pleasure. The staff is absolutely out of this world and they go out of the way to make sure you are beyond comfortable. They even have a complimentary Cadillac car service available for short trips around town. Be sure to check out the Spaahh and Boka as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel within walking distance to most everything”
Reviews.Author: GoWVUMorgantown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a meeting June 1-4 2011. The staff is very friendly, knowledgable of the area, and attentive. Very nice people all around. The room was wonderful. We had a King Suite with a nice view of the city. It was very clean and in good order. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Seattle area. One of the nicest places I have stayed at...

Reviews.Title: “Picked it for the location - LOVED IT for EVERYTHING ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: insomniac419
Reviews.Content: What attracted me in the first place was the location in relation to Pike Place Market. What will bring me back again and again is...EVERYTHING ELSE ABOUT THE HOTEL! Very easy to get to, right on a main downtown street. Despite having to actually go around the block once to wait for other guests to unload their vehicles (very limited drop off space - only two or three spots right in front of the building), the actual valet experience was fabulous. Quick, easy, courteous and streamlined - left me to enjoy my weekend rather than worry about my vehicle, parking, theft, etc. The valet fee was a little hefty above $30, but in the end, I didn't at all mind having to pay for the seamless experience. I was welcomed by luxury and fabulous treatment upon check-in with a glass of sparkling wine. Check-in was easy and I was on my way to my room - which knocked my socks off. Stunning, simple, classy yet modern luxury upon entry. Comfortable, convenient, appealing. I almost didn't want to leave the room! The bathroom was fabulous. When our plans got interrupted, we decided to check out the BOKA restaurant + bar. After 2 drinks and an appetizer, it ended up becoming our evening plans! The decor and ambiance were perfect - the atmosphere was social, warm and comfortable. As the evening progressed, dinner guests left and night life began - but it remained comfortable and social. The bartenders were wonderful - funny, charming, knowledgeable, attentive, and most importantly - knew how to mix drinks better than perhaps anyone I've ever met. The prices were as expected for a downtown hotel bar - not outrageous, but, definitely a little pricey. Again, you're downtown...everything is more expensive. Checkout was simple and to top it off, even after we checked out, we were allowed to leave our bags at the desk and leave our car in valet while we went out and enjoyed our day! No hassle! So we went to the marketplace, enjoyed the wine and cheese festival, and came back to pick up our bags and vehicle! FABULOUS, FABULOUS, FABULOUS. I don't know what else I can say about it. I won't even consider another hotel next time I come to Seattle. It will ONLY be Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “Simply. Wow.”
Reviews.Author: 4959keeton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few "luxury" hotels over the years and found many lacking beneath all of the pomp and pretention they espouse. The Hotel 1000, however, walks the walk in all respects. This is indeed an excellent hotel. My room was a Parlor Suite which had a sitting area and sleeping area divided by a wall. The furnishings were very sleek and modern. The room was on the back side of the building and, unfortunately, only had a view of other buildings. The bathroom had only a shower but it was large and had a rain shower from the ceiling in addition to a handheld shower. One oddity in the bathroom was that all of the toiletries (shampoo, lotion etc.) was dispensed from large bottles bolted to the wall. No souveniers here!. The room had two flat-screen TVs and _all_ of the 60 some-odd channels were high-def. There were even a few "mood" scenery channels which the maids would tune to during the turn-down service. The internet had pretty good speed and there was even an ultra-high speed offered, but I did not try (or feel the need to). The room had very nice Seikl alarm clocks but no radios. The hotel restaurant, Boka, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: PandM0
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the grand luxe city suite and it was perfect. Roomy, great views, large windows, gorgeous decor. Really nice touches and great service. And location provides relatively easy access to all things in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Queen”
Reviews.Author: drileyTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were planning to go to the Seattle area for our 32nd wedding anniversary, so I spent a great deal of time researching the hotels in Seattle. We chose Hotel 1000 above all of the others. Perfect choice! The hotel is located in very close walking vicinity to the market area and many of the great restaurants. I'm glad that we didn't choose another popular hotel right next to the market. When we arrived to Hotel 1000, I was given a beautiful rose and both of us were offered sparking wine. The hotel staff was so helpful and friendly. When we got to our room, we were surprised with delicious chocolate truffles and a white chocolate bark with, "Happy 32nd Anniversary" on it. The room was beautiful, the beds so comfortable, and the bathtub heavenly. We enjoyed the restaurant for a late evening meal and the studio for drinks and dessert near the fireplace. Every time that we asked for our car to be delivered, two bottles of water were in the car, waiting for us. These little perks plus the extremely nice staff are what makes a classy hotel. We had a fabulous time and will return to this hotel the next time we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Truly delightful and a definite "will return" experience”
Reviews.Author: dkmjbasore
Reviews.Content: Having found this hotel while web-surfing for an area we knew nothing about, we believe we have struck GOLD! Hotel 1000 property and exceptional staff met and exceeded every expectation "in spades". Our room was spacious, exceptionally clean and well furnished with very attentive and pleasant maid service. In short, kudos to the hotel and its entire staff. We very much look forward to our next trip to Seattle and our anticipated stay at Hotel 1000. However, one cannot speak of the hotel itself without mentioning the adjoining BOKA Kitchen and Bar is both small and cozy and a gastronic delight. While plenty of other restaurants abound in the area, we ended up eating most meals at BOKA. A very convient arrangement indeed. The Hotel 1000 and BOKA Kitchen are indeed GOLD awaiting your discovery.

Reviews.Title: “The facility and staff made our experience amazing”
Reviews.Author: northwestdaytripper
Reviews.Content: My wife infant son and myself stayed for a weekend. Traveling with my son was hard at first. Until we arrived at Hotel 1000. The Valet to the front desk made sure we wanted for nothing. They took care of everything. I will waste no time talking about the facility itself due to the fact that it is flawless. The people that work in this establishment are professionals, courteous, caring and efficiant in every way. I live and travel the northwest very often and this is the first time I have taken the time to write a review. I would not concider staying anywhere else in the future in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “What a cool place to go!”
Reviews.Author: Sensitivo02
Reviews.Content: Champagne at check in, smiling staff, super-cool rooms, great food, great amenities. What more could you ask for? My favorite part is the "golf club" which is a dual golf simulator in which you hit real golf balls with real clubs, seriously so much fun. They'll even serve you from the Boka Bar while playing golf!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - 1000 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 has everything for a great stay in Seattle. The location is perfect, the rooms are nice and large, there are a restaurant and bar for when you’re hungry and thirsty, and there is even a gym and spa. We used American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts to book the room, and we were upgraded to a larger room, had complimentary breakfast for two each morning, 4:00PM check out, and a $100 voucher to use at the spa. When we checked in, we were treated to glasses of champagne, which was a nice touch. We were also presented a note from the general manager welcoming us to the hotel. The lobby itself isn’t very big, but there is always water in the afternoon and coffee in the morning for guests to enjoy. We were in room 802, which was a corner suite overlooking Madison Street and the back of the hotel. The room was very spacious! Windows wrapped the entire room, so there is a lot of sunlight. Towards the back of the room by the rear windows, there is a long sofa and a comfortable chair. A flat-panel TV is in the same area, and it is on a swivel bracket so you can turn the TV towards the bed if you want to watch shows from there. There is also a large desk in the room that overlooks the street. The closet space is also huge. A mini bar is located in the room, and you can make your own coffee in the morning with coffee grinds and a French press. The bathroom was pretty impressive. There is a separate shower, tub, and toilet. The tub is pretty neat because the water comes from the ceiling. Just remember to close the blinds when you’re taking a bath here because people passing by on the street can definitely look in. There are two very comfortable robes in the room, and all the lotions, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are Molton Brown. The room has free Wi-Fi, so it was easy and convenient to stay connected. The turndown service is also nice. When they turn down your bed, they leave you with two pieces of chocolate that were very tasty! We had our morning breakfast in Boka, and the food was really good. Everyone raves about the truffle fries, so I requested it as a potato side with my meal. The cook obliged (since it wasn’t on the menu), and it was very good! I also had the croissant French toast that was pretty good. The breakfast meal portions are big, so wake up hungry! The location is great! Pike’s Market is about a 5-minute walk down 1st Avenue and the harbor is a couple of blocks down from the hotel. The only down side about the location is that it’s towards the bottom of a large hill, so if you need to head inland, you have to walk up steep hills. Parking is pretty expensive here at $39 plus tax. But the valet guys are very good and fast. Each time someone got our car, we have two bottles of water with their compliments in the drink holders. We would definitely stay here again. The staff always said hello when we came into the hotel, and the location is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: buonduacon
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel 1000 through Amex Fine Hotels and Resort and automatically upgraded to suite with 2 free breakfast per day stay and $100 voucher for use in Spa. Greeted with Champagne on arrival. Corner suite with great views of the harbor. Suite spacious with LV style decor. Bathroom large. Bed comfortable Had free Wifi but not sure bc we were upgraded. Kids loved using the tub for bubble bath with water falling from the ceiling. Location downtown with associated traffic noise, ambulance sirens, etc. Approx 15 minute walk to Pike Market Place. Walk down to the Harbor then to Pike's Market Place to avoid the hills. 10 minute walk to catch the Ferry to Bainbridge Island. Not much to do on Bainbridge Island but the view of Seattle skyline was phenomenal. About $7 cab ride to catch ferry to Victoria. Wife used voucher for a massage but was not impressed with the Spa facilities. Make sure to check out the library on 4th floor and go down to the basement to try to virtual golf and video games on LCD projection. Offered Xbox Kinetic as well as Wii. Exercise room small but had enough equipment to break out a sweat. Ivar's and Crab Pot food was average. Almost like going to Red Lobster. Blueacre restaurant little more pricey but definitely worth it. It's a short walk from the Westlake Mall. Baked clams, fish and chips, salmon were delicious compared to the other two mention restaurants. Have cooked Dungeness crab delivered to your room from Pike's Market Place Fish Market to enjoy while looking at the sunset over the Elliott Bay. Negotiate with airport limo (available in parking structure across the airport) to arrange transportation into downtown. Cost us $55 for 4 adults, 2 teens, and 2 small kids. Typical taxi would have been $45 for 4 passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 definitely deserves a five star rating.”
Reviews.Author: Educator64
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 treats every customer as a VIP by a warm greeting by the valet, glass of champagne at check-in, rooms that are clean, neat and well designed. The bed and breakfast package provided us an opportunity to eat in the Boka Restaurant. The servers, chef and manager went out of their way to make us feel so special. The food was outstanding. We ate dinner and breakfast in the Boka. Suggest you try the bartender's special old fashion as your first drink. When we picked up the car for departure the valet had placed two fresh bottles of water in the car for our travel to the airport. We will go back to the Hotel 1000 in Seattle WA the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. More than expected...”
Reviews.Author: TheMexicanCurious
Reviews.Content: Great room. I wish I had stayed more days. Comfortable bed. Nice restroom. Very clean. They have house car that can take you places near...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: olmanrunner
Reviews.Content: Web surfing brought us to this hotel. Looked good on the website, but turned out the stay was better than expected. Valet attendents were welcoming and efficient. Front desk folks were equally efficient and helpful with any question. General appearance inside was impressive as the website indicates, the rooms wonderful. I liked the design of the room. Bigscreen TV with optional "relaxing" scenes for playing was unique. I liked the bathroom areas. Unique fixtures, glass enclosed shower and commode. We had a tub that draws water from an opening above the tub from the ceiling. Bathroom had a glass barrier between it and the bedroom but an electronic curtain could be used for privacy if needed. The beds mattress was perfect for us and linens top notch. Room lighting was very good. This is an upgraded building in an older part of downtown, but nice location just a few blocks from the waterfront. The restaurant was nice, food very good, but I wish the portions were larger though. All in all, one of the nicer Hotels to stay in and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern friendly Hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Lemon069
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean , modern Hotel with friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with fabulous staff!!! Thank you for making our stay so memorable”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccaonthego
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my mum, my Maid of honor, and I decided to drive down from Vancouver to shop for a wedding dress. We had not made a reservation in advance thinking we would find something when we got into town. I had stayed at the hotel 1000 a couple years ago and suggested we head over there as it is only a couple of blocks from pike place and has nice, modern rooms. We were greeted with a glass of champagne in the lobby while the Valets parked the car and brought the luggage up. We had a lovely room and decided to have happy hour in the bar.... After I skyped my fiancé with the free Internet. We ordered snacks and martinis from the friendly bar staff and I went to talk to the concierge about making a dinner reservation (this was at about 6:30 on a saturday) Marty the concierge was fabulous!!! I explained what we were looking for and he had us a 7:00 pm reservation at an amazing funky Italian restaurant and the name of a bar we could go to after, that made custom drinks based on your favorite flavors and spices?! When we went up to our room to change for dinner our doorbell rang and it was Matty with a red rose saying congratulations on buying your wedding dress and he hoped we had a wonderful evening! We did! The hotel also has very comfortable beds - a real bonus! We checked out but left the car with the hotel which was no problem at all - they had even comped our parking when we checked in and when we picked it up from the valet in the afternoon there were three bottles of water in the cup holders for our drive home. Every little detail was taken care of and the staff really couldn't have made us feel more welcome. We will be staying with you again!!! I think all of want to recreate the weekend (hotel and restaurants le spiga and the baguette box) again with our significant others. Hopefully there aren't to many spelling mistakes as I have written this in my iPhone. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: applejuicetraveler
Reviews.Content: I loved my one night stay. The staff took care of everything. The rooms are nice. LOVE the bathtub. Room service breakfast was super yummy. Lounge is hip with good drinks. And they have a car there. So you don't need to take a cab if your dinner reservations are too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Literally the best hotel experience ever! I'm not kidding.”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTraveler13_13
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to the reviews on trip adviser and other hotel rating sites. I was blown away when I got there. This place was incredible and the service was actually even better. I went with my new girlfriend who I was trying to impress and succeeded! We had complimentary champagne at check in, they brought up a mini fridge for free because we purchased so much stuff at the market, and room service was affordable and over the top. I have traveled all over the world, but this was with out question my best hotel experience ever! This place is legit.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Service”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: Obviously a great property, as echoed by the general theme of other reviews. There were two reasons I highly rate this property: 1. The property and especially the rooms are very engaging. The colours, textures, and materials really invite you to enjoy the experience of being in the room, and few properties really excel in that regard. Great electronics and Molton Brown toiletries are pluses as well. 2. I also found the service to absolutely excel. I was staying on AA miles on a first visit and mentioned to reception after seeing the otherwise great room that I was an extremely light sleeper and thought street noise might be a problem. The hotel was virtually full, but the receptionist scanned a moment and came up with a suite in a very quiet location. Many properties would not have done the upgrade, which I consider a testament to their service culture. Used the light rail to and from the airport, as the station is just a short walk from the hotel, and they offer complimentary service in their Caddy to nearby locations in the city core.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary bliss”
Reviews.Author: Terborg-o
Reviews.Content: We cashed in some air miles to stay here on our last night in Seattle as we couldn't get another night at our B&B. Surprisingly, it included tax so we were off to a good start. I picked this based on the TA reviews and because I wanted a great bathroom and a great tub. I got it! We were greeted with a glass of champagne on arrival in honor of our anniversary (nice) and then got an upgrade to a corner room, higher up. We paid for this and it was a great room, but as we were only there overnight - I'm not sure I'd do it again if it were not a special occasion. Totally worth it though - gorgeous, huge room. Chocolate platter delivered to our room. Amazing nights sleep - so quiet and bed was huge and comfy. And the tub! Bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Great first impression...a few dissapointments”
Reviews.Author: My_name_is_not_Sam
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our 10th anniversary, my husband and I stayed in a deluxe water view room on the 12th floor. We only had 1 night to celebrate, so we decided to make it extra special and booked the "1000 ways to say I love you" package, which included breakfast for 2 in the restaurant or in room, sparkling wine and chocolates, rose petals for the bed and bath, free valet parking, and 1 free in room movie. This hotel was quite a splurge for us, so we expected it to be amazing in every way. At first everything seemed perfect, the valet service was nice, check-in was friendly and we were offered sparkling wine, the room was beautiful, with big windows with a nice view (there are buildings infront of the water, but we expected that) and the bath was wonderful! Upon arrival to our room, we were greeted with a small fruit topped cake with a sign made out of chocolate that said "happy 10th anniversary" and our name, along with the wine and chocolates. So far so good. But we didn't see anything about breakfast or the rose petals, and assumed they would be brought later. Eventually they called and said they had our breakfast certificate, which they had forgotten to give us earlier. Well, we never did get our petals, which we were told got delivered to the wrong room. They did compensate for it at check-out by taking a little off our bill. But I have to say, the breakfast was a big dissapointment. We ordered in room service from the order form that you put out on the door at night...there were really only 2 options besides a continental breakfast: Boka breakfast which my husband ordered, and omlette, which I ordered, along with a glass of orange juice each. (I had been looking forward to french toast which I saw online, but it wasn't even on the menu there.) The Boka breakfast was measly and over done: one egg, some bacon, a bit of hashed brown potatoes, and a very flat dry english muffin, slapped very un-presentably on the plate. My omlette was ok, but nothing better than what I've had at far cheaper places! And the cost for that came to $48!!! Well, we were told we "went over" on our complimentary breakfast, (which we still had to pay room service fee) and were charged extra! There was no previous explanation of what we were allowed to get, so we assumed it was the 2 main meals offered. I would suggest not bothering with the extra packages. They don't seem worth it at all, and only left us feeling dissapointed and a little scammed. I'm afraid those details prevent me from recommending this hotel. Too expensive, and not enough to make it worth that price.

Reviews.Title: “Slipped in customer service,”
Reviews.Author: ChiMasters
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times, and always loved it. We joined their membership program, IPrefer, anticipating future stays and rewards. For our stay in late February, we were upgraded, per IPrefer, to a waterview room. We had a delightful time, loved the room and the friendliness of the staff. This past visit, March 23rd, the front desk person was not friendly, told us they were fully booked and no upgrades available through our membership in IPrefer. She offered an upgrade to an Executive Suite for $50.00. We took it, but the room she gave us had absolutely no view (the back of a building with a light that shone all night) and it seemed very dark and dungeonlike. The television in the bedroom did not work and after trying for a while to get the television to turn on, we discovered it was unplugged! We went online and discovered that water-view rooms were available for that night on their website. Also IPrefer membership partners with Alaska Airlines and gives 500 miles for each stay. We gave our Alaska Airlines mileage number for both recent stays to the front desk, but to date the activity has not shown up. Very disapointed with our stay this time. We travel to Seattle quite a bit for business, and probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury Hotel in Seattle - great location & value”
Reviews.Author: imustcreate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Portland, OR and travel to Seattle, WA quite frequently for both business and leisure trips. We've stayed at numerous boutique hotels in the downtown Seattle area, but none compare to Hotel 1000. We stayed at Hotel 1000 for two nights over the weekend and it was one of the best Seattle trips we've ever experienced. The location of the hotel is ideally situated in the downtown area, with only a short walk to Pike Market, the retail district, Pioneer Square, and the waterfront. The hotel staff are both pleasant & accommodating, and the suites all feel (and smell) very fresh and clean. The rooms on higher floors have views of Puget Sound, and, on a clear day, the mountains on the Olympic Peninsula. You can relax and watch the ferries go back and forth into the sunset. The beds were very comfortable, the linens were of high-quality, and the sound-proofing in the rooms was excellent-- we did not hear city noise or any of the other guests during our entire stay, thus ensuring for a very restful sleep. The soaking tubs are the largest & deepest I've ever encountered in any hotel, and they also fill from the ceiling, which is unique in itself. The hotel also has a boutique spa, with a very accommodating staff, and the spa treatments are simply divine. I would highly suggest pampering yourself with a few nights at Hotel 1000 if you are planning a trip to the Emerald City. You will feel completely refreshed upon your check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Might be the best Seattle has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Fiddlerrpk
Reviews.Content: Having not stayed @ the Four Seasons (yet), Hotel 1000 in Seattle is an all around perfect experience. From the modern, well appointed room to the knowledgeable staff, this hotel is top of the line. From the valet to the front desk hosts, to the bartender, everyone and everything impresses. They really make an effort to personalize your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at in a long time”
Reviews.Author: tnniw444
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and bright. Large than expected. Great view. The staff went above and beyond in every area. Great location down town I will stay again

Reviews.Title: “In-City Luxury - mostly”
Reviews.Author: wavesplasher
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked a corner waterview room, and that had the best water views in the hotel. There are too many large buildings blocking the view otherwise. The person who checked us in seemed new to the Hotel, so I didn't find our greeting particularly gracious, but the check-in was fairly quick. For instance, she knew nothing about the direction our room would face. I'd heard all about the ceiling fixture from where the water flows into the tub below, so I was prepared to be awed, but the water splashed out of the tub onto the floor tiles (making the floor slippery) and nearby window, so this isn't a feature I'd repeat in my home. The tub was long and narrow and the window looked onto an adjacent building. There was an electronically operated shade, so our privacy was preserved, but not its views. Our room's furnishings all showed wear, which surprised me given the price of our room $400+, but the high quality sheets and pillows made for a wonderful night's sleep. We were provided with french press-ground coffee, which was magnificent - a clear contrast to the bland coffees provided elsewhere. The city location afforded nice shopping opportunities, and it's only a few blocks away from Pike Place Market, a "must" for tourists. The valets were on top of our requests and very helpful. We were here for a special anniversary and the Hotel provided a white-chocolate plaque decorated in milk chocolate with our names, which accompanied six chocolate creams. We had a very good time. The downstairs restaurant seemed to be hopping, but the guest quarters upstairs were quiet. Our Internet connection kept failing, but we didn't need it much, anyway. Be prepared: it's $36.00 for overnight parking.

Reviews.Title: “If you travel to Seattle, this is the hotel you should stay at!”
Reviews.Author: RCT_25
Reviews.Content: I travel for business weekly, and travel to Seattle very frequently. I also stayed at a variety of hotels. Hotel1000 leads the pack in terms of service and quality. The rooms and beds are extremely comfortable, they have a decent gym for exercising (a few ellipticals, tread mills, weights, machines etc.), but their level of service is what always impresses me. They make me feel like I am at my home away from home, remember how I like the room (temperature, location within the hotel etc), and have always found a way to complete every request I have. A great example of their service is that when I check in, they always have a few pictures of my family in my room. Granted, I am a frequent traveler to their hotel, but I am a frequent traveler to other hotels as well, and this is the only one that has gone to this extent to make me feel comfortable. I must also say, living and traveling in the Pacific Northwest, with our inclement weather, I love the fact that they will have my shoes shined and ready for me by the next morning! Like the title of this review, if you go to Seattle, this is the hotel you should stay at. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey80304
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Seattle for a long weekend and stayed at Hotel 1000. LOVED IT!! The staff was friendly, I LOVED the glass of champagne we were given when we checked in, our room was clean and nice with a lovely view of the bay. The location is FANTASTIC, walking distance to everything (for us anyway) and next time we will try out the virtual golf! The restaurant is also a highly rated and lived up to the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, clean and luxurious stay - Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: Krissy7777
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel stays ever! Clean, clean, clean! Beautifully decorated - AMAZING staff. Felt like I was on vacation in the room even though I was there for work. Everyone was personable, attentive, warm and welcoming. The room was spacious - CLEAN - and super comfortable. I slept like a baby after an incredible room service meal that came to my wacky specifications - love this place and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves its good ratings.”
Reviews.Author: BBSammamish
Reviews.Content: I expected it to feel pretentious and it wasn't, and it was one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in. We could tell that the staff was well trained in customer service. Our suite was large, well decorated, quiet, and very comfortable. Our only complaints were the moldy smell in the bathroom, and that they advertised "live music" in the lounge in the their information book and there wasn't any.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what it is........”
Reviews.Author: DreamyVacay
Reviews.Content: Great location but definitely not 5 star. Ver clean and modern and the boutique feeling. We were happy that it was close to to everything. You have to check out Brooklyn at happy hour time. Back to the hotel, the staff was very friendly and very attentive. The lounge next door is very nice and great to pop in after a long night. Overall we were happy and will return when we are in Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 1000”
Reviews.Author: roaminnomad
Reviews.Content: Started with friendly staff and a glass of champagne at check-in and went uphill from there. The room was immaculate and had a very cool and modern, yet comfortable feel. It may be an unnecessary effect to have one's bath water come out of the ceiling above, but it got this non-tub soaker to run a bath! Added touches such as a French press coffee maker, soft robes and even a fun little rubber ducky really made an impact. Somehow I didn't even mind that my window faced directly into the side of the next building. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I did not experience any outside noise. Breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was lovely - my dish of fresh mixed berries and sliced grapes was far superior than the usual bowl of under-ripe melon and hard pineapple I'm used to at some of the chain hotels. The front desk, cleaning and restaurant staff were all very helpful and extremely courteous. Very impressed with Hotel 1000 and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: CalebTumon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! My girlfriend and I spent the weekend and had an outstanding time. It is convenient to all of downtown and walking distance to Pike's Place, Museums, Waterfront and many other sites. Rooms are well designed. Not overly large but we didn't feel like we were stumbling over each other either. Used the spa and had drinks in the bar...both were excellent. Next time I am in Seattle, I'll definitely stay at Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Casebas
Reviews.Content: Excellent high end hotel without a lot of the "attitude" a la W. Small bar/restaurant with otherwise top notch in every way.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Kikitfw
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally efficient and friendly staff. Quiet and well appointed rooms. Lots of details that make for an excellant hotel. From the personal greeting when we arrived to the water in our car when we left. Good location. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BobDong
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Seattle for 3 night at Hotel 1000 as part of our honeymoon in the USA. The staff are exceptionally helpful and the atmosphere perfect. The rooms are decent sized and well equipped. If you are planning a visit to Seattle then I cannot imagine a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “I would visit Seattle just to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobbyV17
Reviews.Content: Just staying at the hotel is like a little vacation. The concierge greets you with champagne, the bathroom is like something you would find in a spa, and it's right down the street from the best oyster bar in town. The room was well appointed and had a beautiful view of the water. Also, on a practical level, internet access is complementary, there's a french press in the room for your morning coffee, and you can get a great breakfast brought up to your room as early as 6am.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right - this place is awesome”
Reviews.Author: TacoMel
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at Hotel 1000 while in Seattle for business. The hotel is about a 3 block walk from the Link train station that goes to the airport, a 10 minute walk from Pike Place market, and three blocks from the ferries. There were a number of high-tech features in the rooms. All the lights in the room can be controlled from switches by the headboard, which is convenient. Also the "do not disturb" and "make up room" are buttons that light up outside, not the little cards you always wonder if some jokester will move around. And finally the TV was computerized and had local area info, such as restaurant menus. The high-speed internet was reliable at all hours I used it. The attached restaurant (Boka) was decent although some other good places (Brooklyn, Metropolitan Grill) are just a few blocks away. All in all I have no complaints and I would definitely stay at this hotel again if in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Only a couple of minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: 5MauiLovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a last minute overnight trip and booked at the Hotel 1000. Right from the start we were greeted by the friendly valet. The front desk attendant was very cheerful, quick and helpful. Our room was beautiful in every way! Since we were enjoying a rare night/morning kid free, we were looking forward to sleeping in and decided to splurge and order room service for breakfast to be delivered at 9:45 am. Unfortunately we were startled awake by loud knocking at 8:45 am. It was our breakfast and hour early! So much for a rare sleep in for us. The breakfast was delicious! The only other problem was that the outlet in the bathroom didn't work so I had to dry and curl my hair by the tiny light at the bar. Overall the hotel was beautiful with only a couple of disappointments. We would stay again but maybe no room service so we can sleep in :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayadog
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Nice rooms. Fabulous location. Decent restaurant. Very quiet. Luxurious bath. Only complaints: horrible room service experience and was charged for a water view room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing combination of luxury and efficiency.”
Reviews.Author: KOKOMOSeattle
Reviews.Content: We brought our extended family to the Hotel 1000 for our daughter's wedding in October. We were given extraordinary service, the staff was not only efficient, but very friendly and extremely accomodating. Our wedding guests who stayed at the hotel were not only pleased with their rooms but mentioned how quiet and peaceful their nights' stay was in the middle of downtown. The hotel's restaurant Bokka catered the wedding and was the sight of many meals and conversations during the weekend. We were more than pleased with the quality of the food as well as how imaginative and appropriate their offerings were. I would highly recommend the Hotel 1000 as a wonderful place to stay and as an event venue.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: RachelAlyse
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Hotel 1000. The staff was welcoming and willing to work with us to create our perfect evening. The ability to have personal service for happy hour while virtual golfing was an excellent bonus for the unskilled golfer! The room as well as the views were beautiful. My favorite part being the bath tub that fills from the ceiling! Our romantic evening was topped off with rose petals and a chilled bottle of champagne - as well as mini pumpkin birthday cupcakes for my special guest!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: bathtubrequired
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and I'm always a little disappointed in the hotel (they never live up to the pictures). But I really liked this place and thought other reviewers pics didn't really do it justice (sorry, too lazy to take my own. The room was spacious, comfortable, and modern - but not in that you-just-walked-into-a-club W Hotel way. I also appreciated chocolates at turndown, free choice of Seattle Times/NYTimes in the morning, coffee with french press in the room, great huuuuge bathroom, excellent location downtown close to museum, pike place market, ferries and countless swanky hotel bars. Service was excellent and valet was really quick, even during Thanksgiving weekend. People say great things about the restaurant though we didn't eat there (it was more W hotel) but there was a nice lounge area with a fire table that was really cozy to sit by, we carried drinks in there from the bar and it was really nice. We got a water view room, and though we were on the 9th floor there was still a pretty big building in front, so I wouldn't pay extra for the view again but I really have no other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: cornelljhr
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the interior design are cutting edge stunning. All amenities are top line. No corners cut; no pampering spared. Of all the hotels and b&b's I've stayed at on four continents, this was the best overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Angmayer
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in the Pacific Northwest. The staff is amazing and treats you like you're the only person staying at the hotel. Located on first street in Seattle it is in the perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, with maybe some service issues”
Reviews.Author: Chistery
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights at the Hotel 1000. Thanks to Amex FHR I was upgraded to a suite, which whilst it had no view, was very nice. The room has some nice features, such as an audio cable to plug your mp3 player into the TV. A lot of hotels now provide you the ability to connect your music or laptop to the TV, but never give you the cables, and who carries one with them? There was also an ipod cable so you could connect that or charge it if needed. It's about the only hotel I've stayed in where the HD TV displays everything in the right format. There is some style over substance. The bath that fills from the ceiling may look nice, but in reality it splashes water everywhere, and the water had to be on full to get it hot. It's then almost impossible to top up the bath later on. The hotel is in a great location, a few blocks from the University Street station if you come in via the Light Rail, just head for the 2nd Ave exit. Ordered a continental breakfast on my first day, and all I got was a yoghurt muesli thing. The tray came with jams and butter, but a bit pointless with no pastries or croissants to have them with. Wasn't sure if I'd made a mistake on the card or not, but didn't seem much of a continental breakfast. The breakfast card also wasn't replaced so hard to re-order the next day. I decided on breakfast in the restaurant after that, and one time was seated then ignored, a coffee came with no spoon or sugar, but no issues the other times. All the staff I did interact with, seemed to be genuinely happy and interested. Overall, the hotel has a very good hard product, and except for a few issues with the soft product, I had a very enjoyable stay. I would stay again if I go back to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “biggest disappointment, lots of hype no service”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds41
Reviews.Content: We booked this for hotel for our honeymoon. When we arrived we were not given the room we booked online. They told us they could not do anything for us. The room must have been the smallest in the hotel. My new bride was left crying in the lobby while we left the hotel to find another place to stay at the last minute. For a hotel that is rated the one of the best in Seattle we were thoroughly disappointed with their service, their unwillingness to provide an alternative solution especially when it was the very first night of our honeymoon. I have managed a restaurant for 5 years. If I treated my customers the way this hotel treated us I wouldn't have a business. Extremely disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: 58595Annie
Reviews.Content: The view was great, the room was wonderful and everyone was so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Kattya5
Reviews.Content: We had a conference for JetBlue AIrways. Kelly Norwalk and Amy Wilson were absolutely terrific. This was the first conference I hosted in my region, and Kelly and Amy made the event flawless! I am so happy that I chose Hotel 1000. Interestingly, I found out about this property when visiting other properties and they asked if I was considering Hotel1000. I hadn't even heard of them, but since the competition seemed to be worried, I asked my assistant to contact them. How lucky! The entire team was tremendous! Thank you for a great event.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: be01057
Reviews.Content: This review is probably long overdue. I travel to Seattle several times/year and I always stay at Hotel 1000. I just completed my 16th stay there over the past two years. The rooms are modern, spacious, always clean and extremely comfortable. In addition, the staff is FANTASTIC. They always greet me by name whenever I arrive, make sure I'm in the best room available, and they reward their repeat customers with some nice perks (free goodies in the room, upgrades, etc). Also, they have a great restaurant attached to the hotel (which translates to good room service - always important). Usually, when you go to one hotel a bunch of times, you're bound to have a bad experience eventually. So far, Hotel 1000 has not disappointed. It's not the cheapest option in town, but I'd definitely recommend it for business or leisure to anyone willing to spend a little $. You'll get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location, Excellent Food”
Reviews.Author: Zyosia
Reviews.Content: My husband and travel regularly to the Hotel 1000, mostly for fun in Seattle. I have never been disappointed with my stays. The front desk staff always acknowledges us by name, the service is wonderful, the rooms are spotless, and the food is fresh and delicious. I never hesitate to recommend the Hotel 1000 to all of my friends as well as my colleagues in the industry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaylinf
Reviews.Content: Staff and Amenities are 5 star quality. I will be staying at Hotel 1000 on my next trip up to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: angelsiou1
Reviews.Content: One word...EXTRAORDINARY!! Everything about it was amazing. They made us feel like we were their only guest. I can't wait to go back and visit Seattle just so I can stay at the amazing hotel. Oh and the rubber duckie in the tub made it homey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: mncapitalist
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Seattle. Good location, nice rooms, great beds, very clean. Wonderful service. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: TEEVEE
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay from start to finish! The room was large and very comfortable. Open bath with water from the ceiling and view to the TV was the perfect place to relax after a wonderful massage at the hotel's spa. Every staff member was warm, friendly & helpful. Even had complimentary overnight shoe shine and I had 2 pair come back looking brand new. Restaurant in lobby had a good breakfast and the relaxing "fireplace" lounge in lobby was an ideal spot for a quiet glass of wine in the evening. Easy wireless connections for computers, great storage space in the room. Large separate shower in the modern bath. Location is a bit of a walk from the center of downtown - but it's not difficult. Exceptional service even continued when I check out and the valet brought the rental car around where I found cold water bottles in each cupholder and a note thanking me for my stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: paulhempstock
Reviews.Content: Rooms and public areas are very nice and superclean - gym was pretty good and modern. I had a room facing the back, which means a view of a concrete wall - get one at the front if you can. I did not rate the restaurant very highly - in Seattle coffee needs to be better than that! Free WiFi was great and worked in every part of the hotel with high bandwidth.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CLGibbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights the last week of September 2010. Very modern upscale decor, very clean, friendly staff and great location. The water view rooms are nicer than the alley rooms as at certain times of day can be a little noisy. No problems at all and even got free parking while there!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: peteNrete
Reviews.Content: Thankyou to all the staff at Hotel 1000 for making the 3 nights we stayed there on our Honeymoon a most enjoyable experience. Check in was quick, friendly and personable without being stuffy like a lot of hotels, the glass of champagne on arrival was a nice touch. The room was a very good size and immaculate, and housekeeping did a great job keeping it that way. We got a call from guest services shortly after settling in asking us if everything was ok, i told her everything was perfect, including the lovely chocolate covered strawberries and bottle of champagne and the card congratulating us on our marriage, thankyou again. The complimentry use of the Hotel Cadillac for trips downtown and back was fatastic, thanks Jordan for a great job. The Boka restaurant is a great place for a meal or just a drink at the bar, the meals were very good and very reasonably priced, as was breakfast. All in all the Hotel 1000 is a great place to stay, with friendly staff great rooms and good food, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best.”
Reviews.Author: monmouthspring
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel1000 is wonderful. The best. Combine an outstanding staff with a fabulous facility and it makes for a great stay. The rooms are extremely well designed. Tubs fill from the ceiling!!!. Room lighting is amazing. The beds are beyond comfortable. DId I mention beautiful? The rooms are stunning.
