The restaurant was wonderful with the most amazing food and design. I also had the opportunity to enjoy the spa, it is small and lacks some of the amenities I enjoy but the therapist did a GREAT job on the two hour deep tissue massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: k1r5tyLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel 100 in June 2009 with my husband after driving up the coast from San Francisco on our way to Vancouver. We stayed here for 2 nights and it was fantastic to have such luxury after a few nights on the road. The bath tub is massive and also an interesting design feature, the bed is very comfortable and the room itself seemed huge. The hotel is ideally located right near the waterfront and pioneer square, and has great amenities. We drank in both bars (one of them even has a microsoft surface to play with) but we didn't eat in the restaurant or (to my dissappointment) have time to use the spa. Seattle is a great city and next time i visit i would love to stay here again, however it is a little on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Delight!”
Reviews.Author: seannorman
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here, and it was overall one of the nicest experiences I've had a hotel. The front desk staff were among some of the nicest and most genuinely caring I've encountered while on the road. Jennifer (I believe?) upgraded my room for me upon arrival, and I had a stunning corner suite with the most amazing bathroom I've ever seen. The bath tubs are to die for, and the fact they fill from the ceiling really only add to the whole experience. After about ten minutes, Jennifer called up to make sure everything was as I'd wished which I thought was very, very nice. Later that evening, the reception staff again went out of their way to get me a fork (grocery shopping without thinking about how to eat what I buy). I actually woke up 45 minutes after check-out time the next day, and was given all the time in the world to finish getting packed and checked-out comfortably. The staff here really made my staff as memorable as it was, but the stunning rooms sure helped as well. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Special thanks to Jenn & all the front desk staff!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SPman00
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. We had a high floor room overlooking the water and the location on 1st Avenue was great. Only irritation was the small fitness center, only three working cardio machines for a hotel this size.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: cmclmorgan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several 4 and 5 star hotels. From the moment I drove up to the hotel, until the moment I checked out, I was impressed. The staff were extremely friendly, professional and helpful. My room, a Deluxe King, was amazing. The artwork, the bathroom (as many others have raved about), the view, the maid service, room service, valet, conseire, the Boka bar and restaraunt, etc. Everything was perfect. And they have bath robes which is a nice touch that not all 4 and 5 star hotels include. Before my stay at Hotel 1000, I read all of the reviews here. Yes they charge for the bar and snacks but there are warning signs that inform you that it is all electronically monitored. The price for the room and services is well priced in my opinion. Yes it is a little on the expensive side but, the personalized services, the staff, and the beautiful rooms make the price justified. I won't spoil your first experience at Hotel 1000 with any more details. From my experiences with other accomodations, Hotel 1000 is simply the best.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels I've ever had the pleasure of staying”
Reviews.Author: luvstravel11
Reviews.Content: I happened to come accross this hotel on Travelocity - it was a deal I couldn't resist given it's rating (less than $200 a night at the time). My husband and I love "W" hotels, but Hotel 1000 even puts them to shame. We stayed in a standard room - which was still luxurious - the bathrooms - have never had such an amazing bath. We were in Seattle during Winter, and that bath, after the wet chill of the day....who needs a spa?! The starbucks coffee in the room with the french press was a great extra touch. We even ordered room service once evening, and the food was delicious. I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Treatment, Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: kwidjybo
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on my honeymoon through the Northwest. The staff was incredible the whole time. I told them when I made the reservation that it would be our honeymoon. When we checked in, there was champagne and strawberries waiting for us. Many times when we would run into the staff in elevators or even in the restaurant, they would recognize us and congratulate us. The entire staff was very friendly. The valets were particularly friendly as well. The lobby had delicious lavender lemon aid that my wife loved. The room had 2 small issues: there was no DVD player and the do not disturb button (with light outside) did not work. I called down and both issues were remedied within 30 minutes. The room was wonderful otherwise. The bathroom in particular was great. We didn't use the famous bathtub, but the shower was great. The restaurant is pricey but very good. We did not use the spa or golf resource. The location was really wonderful. We walked to the Market every day and the waterfront was also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “1000 Wins!”
Reviews.Author: SurferBoy123
Reviews.Content: Two of us spent the weekend here. Excellent value, close to a grocery store, alcholic beverage store, and a decent diner type restaurant across the street. Rooms were clean and fine sized for 2 adults but very acceptable.Staff was helpful in rectifing a reservation error where the dates were off by one day.Parking was easy and as many sites are close by, a real benefit being able to leave the car in safety.We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 gets it done!!”
Reviews.Author: jotis27
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredible. The beds are heaven. The bathrooms are wonderful. The bathtub is really fun - it actually fills from the ceiling. Very cool! We had breakfast at Boka (the restaurant in the hotel) and it was amazing! They have beignets (which are these amazing French fried-donuts I've only had in Baton Rouge, LA)...so that automatically makes them awesome. I had a friend in town staying at the hotel and she said it was a wonderful experience. They had left her chocolate-covered strawberries and a cheese and cracker plate in her room. The GM had written her a personal welcome card. I was just INCREDIBLY impressed by how much the hotel did to make her feel welcome and honored. She felt like it was a safe haven to fall back into at night. I was very impressed with how attentive the staff was. They weren't suffocating about it, but they were available, willing, and ready. It was the perfect blend. I would definitely come back. Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love it here!”
Reviews.Author: Luckyfour
Reviews.Content: This is one fantastic hotel. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Seattle. Staff are friendly and helpful. The modern design is amazing and high marks for comfort. For the tub, the water comes down from the ceiling which is tres moderne. Nice and spacious. It's close to Pike Street Market, interesting stores and Pioneer Square so interesting architecturally. There are free buses that stop around the corner. The hotel has a fitness centre, spa (I'm going this afternoon) and restaurant. Very quiet at night and got a good sleep. I cannot say enough about the design. I felt right at home as some as I good here; very welcomed. Lots of drawers to put your clothes, suitcases etc. so you don't need to have your belongings lying around Very close to the water and we have a great view of the ocean and can see the ferries coming and going. It's maybe three or so streets to get to the oceanfront Piers where you can have lunch and watch people feeding the seagulls. Room service was fast. You really get the West Coast feel staying here with the view and location. I would give the Hotel 1000 five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish!”
Reviews.Author: Kichi_to_go
Reviews.Content: My friend was recommended Hotel 1000 strongly for enjoying Seattle, so I decided to stay here. It was very clean and satisfied. Yes;The hotel is very close to waterfront and easy to get everywhere Downtown. Their staffs are very friendly and helpful. Once I just went out 30 minutes in a day for feeling ill they did bed making and cleaned the room. I was so surprised! No;The hotel is located in 1st street. Basically Seattle has so many steep slopes which always makes me sufferd to up street by walk. And during my stay the television didn't work well for some reason. I am not a tv-addicted person at all but just a little inconvenience. After I got back in Japan I received the survey from the hotel, and I wrote the inconvenience I felt...after that an excecutive somebody gave a responce with great apology. It was enough to feel confortable again! Overall...I definitely would stay here again when I go Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for our sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: janefromtexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at Hotel 1000 prior to our cruise. All staff was outstanding! We were able to check in early. No view, but we knew this when we made late reservation. Room was clean, sleek and comfortable. Hotel has easy access to Bainbridge Island ferry and is very walkable to Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square. The hills of Seattle are steep but the views and sites rewarding. The one time we chose to call a cab for dinner, we were pleasantly surprised to be taken for free by the hotel's car. We only ate at BOKA for lunch. Grilled cheese with tomato soup was tasty, but other entrees just okay. Free computer access was very handy. But the staff was what made all the difference. They all do a terrific job.

Reviews.Title: “More than a Room... An Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TexasChipmunk
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Quality with a double dose of Warmth, Charm and Personality. What I loved, was the feeling that this was really "my hotel". At some hotels you feel like you are an intruder into an exclusive world... like staying at a friends vacation house and afraid to open the drawers for fear you're violating their space. Not so at the Hotel 1000. You are treated like you have come home to a familiar place even though it might be your first time. The staff seems to be allowed to be who they are, and their personality comes through creating a sense of hospitality that some of the worlds best hotels could only dream of. Much different than say the Peninsula, where the staff seem more like servants fearing to interrupt you. Love the Decor and level of detail but anyone can duplicate that, but you can't duplicate the DNA (personality) that is distinctive to the Hotel 1000. My time there was exceptional. Fantastic location. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every way”
Reviews.Author: TeamOladujoye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by high calibre individuals who are motivated attentive and who take the time to make your stay a great experience Seattle because for me (and I’m not posh) it doesn’t get better. The rooms are impeccable (the hotel was three yrs old yesterday - 6th June 09), so everything works well and feels brand new. I have stayed in Raffles in Singapore and other great hotels, but for value, appropriateness and dependability you can’t go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Live Up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: cpf61
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a surprise night at Hotel 1000 for my 40th birthday and had high expectations. We arrived on a Saturday at 4pm and our room was not ready. The woman who checked us in said she would call us when it was ready so we left the hotel to kill time and four hours later we still hadn't heard so we called back. She apologized and said she had had "someone else call us", who apparently didn't follow through with the phone call. When we made it back to the hotel, she was nice enough to comp us a breakfast the next morning. The room was nice, especially the tub. However, the next morning, it took 45 minutes and two inquiries to our waiter for our breakfast to arrive (which was egg whites, toast, and sausage... not too complicated). The restaurant manager came out and apologized for the delay and said he would comp our breakfast, which I told him our breakfast was already "comped" because of another issue. He seemed like he didn't quite know what to say at that point. I asked him what time check out was because our breakfast took so long and it was already 10:45am, to which he said noon. But, I had a hunch that might not be correct so we got back to the room and I called the front desk and found out that check out was actually 11am! Good thing I called. I was really disappointed to be treated to such "nice" hotel and have it not live up to the expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, fantastic view, customer service could be sharper”
Reviews.Author: EU4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an 8th floor corner room overlooking 1st Ave (and the Puget Sound) and Madison Street. It is conveniently located for the Waterfront, Pike Place Market and the Retail Core. The main public transport routes run along 3rd & 4th Avenues and the ferries across Puget Sound (take a round trip to Bainbridge Island to see the city from the water) are 5 minutes walk away. Amtrak & Sounder trains arrive at King St station 15 minutes walk away. We arrived early, so had a lovely lunch in the BOKA restaurant. The checkin time is 4pm. I checked with the receptionist at 3 so see of the room was ready but was told it was nearly ready and she said that she would come and tell me when it was ready. She then went off shift without passing the message on, and we sat waiting until 4pm when I went back to reception. When we got into the room it was beautiful, fantastic views and plenty of room, reasonably comfy bed, sofa, armchair, desk with internet connection point (both ethernet and wi-fi are available free) and spacious bathroom with flat floor shower (no step) and fill from the ceiling bath. Loads of room and (laptop sized) safe in the wardrobe. BOKA restaurant serves good food in reasonable portions, service was friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back...”
Reviews.Author: LSAzcarraga
Reviews.Content: This is hands down at the top of my list of hotels! It was modern and clean and cozy. From the french press coffee maker, to the flat screen tv and the comfy-cozy bed, to the INCREDIBLE soaking tub that fills from the CEILING...I loved everything about my experience at Hotel 1000 and Seattle in general. If I didn't love Orange County, CA so much...I would move there! I can't wait for my husband to go there on business again so I can come back!!

Reviews.Title: “I have never seen a hotel 3 years later better then it was day one!”
Reviews.Author: Lisacpnj
Reviews.Content: Matt Hagermann has one of the finest staffs of any hotel in the world if not the best in the world. Hands down in the USA this staff from the Valets to the concierges, to the desk persons and accounting and housekeeping is elite. I stayed at this hotel before when it 1st opened. I can honestly say that 80 percent of that staff has stayed on board. That is a rare thing anywhere. The staff members are proud to work where they do no matter what the position they are in. The rooms are immaculate. As nice, clean, and maintained as the 1st month they opened this property. The staff made sure that every whim is catered too by frequently asking if there is anymore they can do to make your stay pleasurable. They will gladly make any reservations, suggestions, no matter what or where you choose in Seattle to do that it happens. I have never been to a finer more accommodating establishment with a staff that is truly glad to be there. I would not stay anywhere but in this fine hotel again in Seattle and I can say it is quite a nice feeling to see the same people 3 years ago are still here, quite happy and very proud of their hotel. Kudos to the entire staff and I would tell ANYONE traveling to Seattle to stay here. Never for 1 moment is anyone not treated like royalty and I thank every single person, Janet, Sean, Ricardo, Tara, Monteka, Dana, Miles, Robert, Matt, and Matt Hagermann as always for making this another perfect stay and I can not wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The kind of Hotel you won´t forget and will look forward to returning to when visiting Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: NMPARGENTINA
Reviews.Content: As an event organizer from Argentina we suggested Hotel 1000 to our client after reading Trip Advisor´s review in Dec 2008 and we were definitely not disappointed! Our group stayed for 7 nights so we were able to appreciate the Hotel in all its facets. The staff was excellent, very hospitable and accommodating to our client´s requests. Nothing was a problem: every need was attended to promptly . The Concierges we met and everyone in the Reception area were exceptionally informative, serviceable and friendly. They really couldn´t have been nicer! After personally viewing over 45 rooms I found them to be very comfortable decorated in a trendy style with very modern details including great TV sets and Molton Brown amenities. The beds are extremely lush and cozy, you seem to melt into them. Just 2 rooms on each of the 4th and 5th floors looked a bit gloomy as they looked out unto a blank wall. The bathrooms are an experience! Check out the water falling from the ceiling into the bath tub. Surprisingly there were no bidets in the bathroom! The location is great : Pike Market and Pioneer Square are very close as well as great restaurants though, one must consider that Hotel 1000 is on 1st Ave., at the bottom of a very steep hill so walking to some restaurants on 2nd or 3rd Avenue may be difficult for those physically challenged or young at heart ! The Hotel is not very close to the Convention Center but still within walking distance. 24/7 free of charge Business Center was an added asset Great Hotel in a great city! Will not be forgotten easily. Neptuno Meeting Planners - Buenos Aires, Argentina

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!! Could not have asked for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: Rugdance
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent last weekend in Seattle at the Hotel 1000. What a wonderful experience!!!! We will definitely be coming back to stay! We have nothing but good things to say about the place...and considering we booked the hotel based on other TripAdvisor members' comments, thought it was important to give credit where credit is due. :) The staff was beyond friendly and helpful. Everyone was great--the doormen out front, the front desk reception, the servers in Studio 1000 (hotel lounge), the concierge, the room service staff, the golf attendant, the spa attendant...everyone had a smile on their face! It was as though they were happy to see us! What a wonderful way to spend the weekend at a hotel! The room itself is beautiful...the tub that fills from the ceiling is truly a sight to see. The sheets are extremely soft and the robes are nice as well. The bar comes fully stocked with nice wine glasses, drinking glasses and even a wine opener. The television has a few cool features. One of them is an interactive menu with options such as "Dining," "Personal Music," "Movies," etc. It even had our name up on the screen to greet us when we first checked in. Additionally, there are a variety of scenic views to choose from (which is basically a still video of a landscape with relaxing music in the background). We underestimated the power of this as both of us fell asleep to the soothing sounds of the waves and the view of the beach in Mexico! HBO is included in the room and they have a decent selection of pay-per-view movies. We only entered one issue during our stay, but that issue was resolved efficiently so we have no complaints!!! When we first checked into our room, the screen in between the bathroom and the bedroom area didn't work. We told our bellman and someone at the front desk and they said they would have an engineer up to look at it right away. When we came back about an hour later, it still wasn't fixed. We went downstairs and explained that it still wasn't fixed. They immediately gave us the room next door. The Studio 1000 lounge is wonderful. I can't say enough about it. It's a small, intimate setting with delicious food (the grilled cheese and tomato soup is to die for!) and an amazing wait staff! If you can get a seat around the fire, all the better...but the surrounding chairs are comfortable as well. We could not have asked for better service! One quick example...we went downstairs to Studio 1000 looking forward to cozying up next to the fire, ordering a glass of wine and a few appetizers. When we arrived, we were disappointed to find that there were no more seats available in the small space. Immediately, the manager sugegsted an area where we could wait while he rustled up some chairs (from a different location) so we could sit. He came back right away with two comfortable chairs and placed us right up near the fire. Following our drinks and appetizers, he suggested a few seafood restaurants in the area that we might like to try. The following evening when we went back, he remembered both of our names. It's small details like that that truly make one's stay memorable. The location of the hotel is also great. It's very close to Pike Place Market. We took a cab the first day only to realize that we were only a few blocks away. We were able to walk to nearly every restaurant or lounge we visited. It was only a 10-minute ride to Safeco stadium where we saw a baseball game. I would absolutely, without-a-doubt recommend this hotel to others!!!!!! What a great find!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: GardenCat69
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms were amazing. The sheets were a high thread count and the robes were also high quality. The reception, doormen and room service staff were extremely friendly and I give them top scores. We tend to stay in boutique hotels whenever possible and I would give this one a very high rating. It had the nice extra touches (cool books on the night stands and personal notes, first night cookies.) The only thing that keeps me from giving this hotel the highest marks is the housekeeping staff. We stayed for 2 nights, left for a side trip and returned for 2 nights again at the end of our trip. Our room was in top notch condition the first night of each stay. The second day was the problem: the ironing board was left out both times and the tables that we had our morning room service on were not wiped down. The mini frig was not updated each day either. So if we used the water or sodas the first day, they did not replenish them the second day. The same situation occurred with the bath soap. Having said that, we also did not complain, so management had no way of knowing. But it did happen both of the second days stay. A truly top notch hotel would not require visitors to complain to have the room in top shape.

Reviews.Title: “Average Boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luggs5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for a few days. It was a nice place, but not the end all be all of nice places. It was clean, good location, small rooms, and average service. The exception being a few of the employees real go out of thier way to help you. A nice place to stay, but I don't get all the hype.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say??”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGetaways2_9
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, this hotel stay was fantastic! The friendly staff went out of their way for us, the tv in our room said welcome to us specifically (which was so neat) and the cleanliness of the room was top of the charts. The tub's running water from the ceiling was something to talk about for sure. The bathroom was very clean and shiny which is something high on my priority list. The bed was extremely comfortable and the silence of the room was very pleasing for sleep. Being on a floor high up made for lack of traffic during our stay, and the water view from our room was great. The location was central and only a couple blocks from the Pike Market. For dinner, we called down to the front desk and requested the complimentary car which took us to our restaurant destination in style!.........for free! I didnt ever step foot in the lobby without a staff smiling and greeting us. The first morning we had breakfast in the BOKA restaurant downstairs, which was reasonable, clean and the food was quite tasty. I can't wait to return again to Seattle and will most definately stay here again when I do!!

Reviews.Title: “Like but not love”
Reviews.Author: Matt70380
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on business and it was a thoroughly pleasant experience. Nice contemporary decor without being over-designed (except the water coming out the ceiling for the bathtub). Excellent, friendly staff - perhaps a little too friendly for my English sensibilities. A 'Good Morning Sir' and 'Have a good evening' every time I got in or out of the elevator is a little too intrusive for me; I prefer a little more anonymity in a hotel, but it's not a complaint. Food was good but not great and $15 for some Angel hair pasta with a little marinara sauce is a rip off. Overall very good but there are many fine boutique hotels in downtown Seattle and will probably try somewhere else next time. Would recommend it to a first time visitor though...

Reviews.Title: “All very good, bar the (very bad) concierge service”
Reviews.Author: andrewsydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in early Januray 2009. For the hotel, the in house restaurant food and service was fantastic, ie really, really good, and the rooms were nicely furnished and had great bathrooms. However, getting service from the concierge was a complete waste of time. He often dithered and fussed over nothing and, at the end of the process, gave me wrong information (on a rental car) which caused a long delay to rectify. Also, the hotel claims a courtesy car is available for guests but usually it is not available; for example, we checked out early and the night before confirmed three times with the door staff and the concierge that in the morning we would be able to get a lift; however, come time to use the car and we were denied its use by the concierge because there was only one dorrman on duty. This should have been known the night before, and communicated to us then so we did not need to fuss around getting alternative transport at the last minute. Very sloppy work. Because of this, and notwithstanding the great in house restaurant, we wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “On the Fence”
Reviews.Author: Iloveboutiquehotels
Reviews.Content: My room was on the function room floor, it was strange to walk out of my guestroom to see a buffet station set near my door. Bathroom was beautiful, the bath tub was a nice size and at first the water pouring from the ceiling was fun but it splashed all over the glass wall. It's more of a conversation piece but impractical. The Molten Brown shampoos were mounted on the wall in the shower instead of those environmentally unfriendly miniature bottles. Somehow the germaphobe side of me was grossed out by the thought of someone else using products from the same bottle. For a dark rainy city the decor was a little too gloomy. It's a chic colour scheme but walking in at night after dinner I was left with a lonely feeling. Staff were unimpressionable, neither great nor bad. The gym didn't have windows, I prefer to see natural light when I workout.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: airstreamfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location. We did a lot of walking so we appreciated the location. We used the valet, which is the way to go at this hotel. They were really helpful in providing local information and friendly. The front desk staff was friendly and informative too. The rooms are perfect and relaxing. We changed rooms after stepping in the previous renter's dog pee. I tossed my socks and the hotel moved us to a room at the front of the hotel, and ate the cost of the valet. The room at the front of the hotel was surprisingly quiet. There wasn't much street noise. The stereo and tv are quite nice. The bathroom is incredible. My husband and I loved the shower head and toiletries. Our small children were fascinated with the water pouring from a hole in the ceiling, to fill the bathtub. Also, they loved looking out the bathroom window wall, into the suite. A motorized blind provides privacy, when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: AW14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 1000 recently for a business trip. It was recommended by Virtuoso. (The hotel is a Virtuoso property.) Can't say enough about the customer service - everyone was friendly and attentive...from valet to reception to housekeeping. I had a room overlooking Puget Sound. Great amenities. Literally the only thing "missing" were speakers in the bathroom! There is a great sound system, a 40" tv, beautiful and large bathroom. Beyond the nice touches - like the deep, extra large tub and the hi-tech features it also is very functional. The toilet has a separate door so someone can be washing up and the other in the toilet or shower. The main room was rather large and has a nice small sitting area. There is ample storage and a nice working area for your laptop. I would definitely recommend this hotel - good location and nice amenities. Also, make sure to eat at Boka - the restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terecita47
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went on a romantic get-away to Seattle for the first time and chose Hotel 1000 after reading the reviews on this site. I can't speak for him, but I LOVED pretty much everything about Hotel 1000. I called ahead to order some champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries, which they had waiting for us in the room. The restaurant downstairs was perfect for our first night's dinner. Interesting fun little dishes to try. Hotel 1000 is located near everything you want to see in Seattle. You can walk, bus or ferry anywhere. The staff was phenomenal. Sweet, personable, and extremely helpful. They recommended restaurants to try, islands to visit, and transit plans to get wherever you wanted. They have a complimentary car service, when available, that will bring you to your close by destination free of charge. The boys outside working the door and cabs, etc. are super cute and dressed to the nines but nothing is shi-shi or annoyingly overstated here. The rooms are sleek and beautiful, the bathrooms of course, amazing with the old fashioned bath tubs and water that pours (and splashes!) from the ceiling. The downstairs lounge has a very cool interactive "video game style" map of the area you can sit down by the fire with a drink and map out your plan for the next day. Perhaps my criticisms would be this: Beware of picking up anything in your hotel that you might be charged for!! The sophisticated system seemed to mistake my looking at stuff for consuming it, and it will charge you. This includes some of the bath salts, etc. Just watch it. Mmmmm, kay? Other than that, we loved every minute and didn't want to leave this hotel. I simply can't say enough about Hotel 1000. I never gush about such things. But we had that good of a time. Thank you to the entire staff for making us feel like family!!

Reviews.Title: “Modernism Done Right”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 may be the best modern hotel in America: clean, new, efficient, comfortable, fetching, and generous. It leaves nothing to be desired. I recommend it whole-heartedly. Big rooms, great bathrooms, awesome views, nice gym, two intersting bars/restaurants, in-room amenities deluxe, and a welcoming staff add up to an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: KarenSoCal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to treat ourselves while celebrating our 30th anniversary in Seattle. After reading several TripAdvisor reviews from other travelers, I selected the Hotel 1000 based on the positive remarks regarding the hotel amenities and customer service. There have been many times while traveling that we have had contact with snobbish, condescending hotel staff. None of that kind of service even exists at the Hotel 1000. Either the hotel management does an excellent job of training the staff to cater to its customers or they just are fortunate to hire caring employees who truly enjoy their jobs and want the traveler to have a good experience. The concierges and young valet staff were especially helpful in making recommendations and providing fast service. We stayed in a water view room which provided a wonderful view of the harbor and several historic buildings. It was a surprise upon opening the hotel door to be greeted with uplifting classical music and slides of paintings on the television screen. After a hectic airplane ride it was just what we needed. The hotel is modernistic and it attracts a rather youthful clientele but it's also a haven for a more mature traveler who likes to feel pampered. I'll definitely select the Hotel 1000 on my next visit to Seattle. They made our anniversary celebration a very memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Etowners
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. After trying to figure out where to park the rental car, we decided to cough up for valet parking, which turned out to be a good choice. Simply pull up at the door of the hotel, and turn your car and keys over to a very friendly and efficient member of the parking team. The car is whisked off, and you don't need to worry about it until you need it again. Given the plethora of one way streets in downtown Seattle, it is probably easier to give the car a rest and just walk/transit to wherever you need to go! Reception was speedy, friendly and efficient, and also came with an offer to escort us to our room - we declined that part. Our room was on the 10th floor with a view of the ferries and cargo ships coming and going; actually the action on the water was more fascinating than the TV.... Not that there was anything wrong with the TV (large plasma screen mounted on wall), I just have a problem with the abundance of 'medical product' advertising on US cable channels. Now - as for the room itself - it was beautiful. We had a kingsize bed with crisp linens, lovely glassware, french press coffee maker, beautiful classy decor all in a well thought out room design. As for the bath, what can I say? A deep free standing tub equipped with Molton Brown toiletries, that filled from a hole in the ceiling.... not terribly practical if you want to top up with hot water if you are already in the tub, but a lovely design feature nonetheless. The staff were fantastic, BOKA was great for brunch, and overall, it was a great experience. We would certainly go back, and we strongly recommend Hotel1000 for people who are fed up with the usual corporate hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: oaklay18
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel 1000. My fiancé and I had a wonderful trip to Seattle. We loved the Hotel 1000. Hotel: The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were nice, the tub was great, my fiancé really enjoyed the Gallery Player the hotel has playing when you enter the room. The workout facility was very nice, and the library was a nice place to kick up your feet. We ate at BOKA but probably wouldn't go back. Location: The hotel is right between Pikes Place (I highly recommend the Savor Seattle Food Tour!) and Pioneer Square. Also within walking distance from shopping, the space needle and convention center. Weather: The weather most days was sunny and mild. However in true Seattle form it did rain a couple days. Overall: This hotel is great in a wonderful location. We would gladly stay again during our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Zone”
Reviews.Author: David98
Reviews.Content: Just faultless. We arrived in dire need of some pampering, and we got it. Excellent staff, fabulous rooms, esp. the bathrooms. Good location. Thanks Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: bcary
Reviews.Content: I have been to Seattle a few times now, stayed at a few different hotels. But now I know where to stay, and it's Hotel 1000! The location could not be more perfect (for those of us who frequent the Metropolitan Grill while in Seattle). It's just a short walk away from my favorite attractions. The bathrooms are gorgeous, and very innovative with the soaking tubs and privacy curtains. I will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ces_Mark
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel was a little disconcerting. It took us three trips around the block to figure out where the parking was. In order to park at the hotel, you have to have the valet park your car. However, once we got past the parking stress, the hotel staff was amazing. We were greeted on the way in and the receptionist checking us in was extremely friendly and efficient. The hotel room was the best part. The room was beautiful and large. The bathroom had a huge soaker tub which we didn't have time to try. The Boka restaurant at the hotel had the best mussels I have ever tasted. Happy hour is fantastic. Anyone who stays at the hotel needs to go in for happy hour. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for travellers looking for something unique.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 1000”
Reviews.Author: 77Molly
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel 1000. The best part of the hotel are the small things about it that make it fun. I really enjoyed the photo gallery options on the television and the bathtub that filled from the ceiling was fun. The room was nicely sized and well decorated and the service was great. I'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “Chique boutique hotel with stunning rooms”
Reviews.Author: Critical_Mind
Reviews.Content: Went to Seattle during a sunny week in September and stayed at the Hotel 1000. Check in was very good and the concierge very friendly. The hotel's interior design is stunning using high quality products throughout. The rooms: We had a room on the upper floors with a view over the bay, which was gorgeous. The facilities are fantastic - Sony Flat Screen (massive), very comfortable bed, marble bath room with a free standing bath tub (which is filled from water coming down the ceiling - yes, down the ceiling), separate shower and toilette and Molton Brown toiletries. There was a coffee maker with fresh Starbucks coffee provided for free. A further nice touch was that the TV played classical music whilst showing Italian Renaissance paintings when we checked into the room - I found that a perfect combination. We used the library for reading the daily newspaper - and may I say, it is a true library with a very nice atmosphere. The bar/restaurant served good cocktails and was frequented by both locals and hotel guests giving it a good vibe. Ordered breakfast to our room - delicious, warm and well-presented. You can use two business computers for free (including internet). Summary: Check in / check out: very good Rooms: amazing Facilities: good - they have a small spa, a very nice library, but a gym/pool would have made it a perfect Service: very good

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury”
Reviews.Author: Family-C-L
Reviews.Content: A friend who works at Microsoft recommended the Hotel 1000 to us and we were very happy with the referral. The hotel is modern, quite new (recently changed management I believe) and conveniently located on First Avenue and within walking distance to the Central Market on Pike St. We arrived around 10am and since the room wasn't ready yet, we left our luggage and walked around the neighborhood, which was safe and dotted with cafes and shops. We received a call on our cell phone when the room was ready and then we checked into our room with a half city view, half harbor view. The room was large and comfortable (we slept very comfortably on the bed). The bathroom was also large and stocked with Molton Brown toiletries. As mentioned in previous reviews, there was this funky "waterfall" tap for the bathtub, which is neat in concept + design, but impractical in use. The water merely splattered all over the tub area. Anyway, not a big deal. We were extremely pleased with the service. The hotel had asked us if we were celebrating anything special for our visit and when I told them ahead of time that it was for our wedding anniversary, they surprised us with a bottle of champagne and strawberries upon arrival. That was a very nice touch. They also confirmed our dinner reservations without prompting. The staff even offered to take us to the restaurant in the hotel limousine free of charge. We couldn't have been happier with their friendliness. Overall we definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & trendy”
Reviews.Author: jagoda13
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel w/comfortable accomodations. The bathroom was super stylish & featured a unique waterfall style soaking tub. Unfortunately we weren't there long enough to take advantage. While staff was friendly & the room was comfortable, there certainly was no kid friendly vibe here. Also, some of the surrounding area is a little dodgey, especially for those of us unfamiliar with the city. It is an easy walk however to Pike's Place. If we return to Seattle, we would consider returning here. Perhaps 1 night (w/late arrival & early departure) wasn't enough to do the hotel justice.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: sixsticks
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel 1000 in Seattle, WA prior to going on an Alaskan cruise. Hotel 1000 far exceeded our expectations following extensive online research. You were thoroughly pampered and the words, "no" or "we can't" are not in the staff's vocabulary. They will literally jump through hoops to accomodate you and your needs, no matter what requests you may have. From the doormen to the front desk staff, we were quite impressed. The rooms (we had 7 of them) were just lovely and extremely clean and comfortable. We did not experience any service problems which have been written in previous reviews, i.e., housekeeping problems, lack of clean towels, etc. The French pressed in room coffee was a plus! The location was perfect, centrally located in downtown Seattle. There was rarely a need to use the rental car we had other than for sightseeing trips. There is great shopping and dining within walking distance. I just love and appreciate a hotel with the personal touches such as referring to you by name at all times. Our son lives in Seattle and we have stayed at many other fine hotels. The Hotel 1000 will now definitely be our hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Matsufatsu
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle for the weekend and definitely enjoyed our stay at Hotel 1000. The rooms were gorgeous as they contained plasma televisions, comfortable beds, marble bathrooms, and an awesome tub that filled from the ceiling. They also have their own lincoln towncar which we used to drop us off near Pike's Place Market (when it was available). The market is about a leisure 30 minute walk, but I had sprained my ankle so we used the Hotel's towncar. The only knock on the hotel is that we stayed on the street side and the traffic noise can be a little annoying. Within walking distance to Elliot's Oyster House as well as Seattle Underground. The staff was first rate!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: lavendergirl1962
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a Luxe room with 2 Queens. This room was all that was available when I rebooked after changing our trip dates. Even, the basic rooms are lovely and have the fabulous tub. We loved this hotel! We were greeted by name on arrival. We were just a mom and daughter on a vacation together. Everyone new my name even the bellmen and all concierge. We stayed in luxury hotels our entire trip, and this one was our favorite. We were there June 21-23 and June 27-30. The bathtub is great for soaking. Molton Brown products are in dispensers in the shower, and in small personal bottles for the tub, so you have plenty of product during your stay. The towels are great; I asked for extra ones without a problem. The room and bathroom decorations are very nice. The makeup mirror and vanity area are all nice. The cabinet area and garment bag closets were a nice wood with the decor and provided plenty of storage space. An ironing board and iron were provided. A small bar area has wine, Tazo tea, and a French press with Starbucks coffee in a sealed canister. It was resupplied each day. We had planned to stay in another part of Seattle after returning from Canada, before heading home, but we cancelled and rebooked Hotel 1000 to finish out our stay. We were on the 12th and 8th floors. The room was very clean, and I am picky. No dirty glasses as in other reviews. I heard some ambulance and heavy truck street noise on the 8th floor, but it did not ruin a night's sleep. I preferred the 12th. I had heard about street noise in early reviews. We were celebrating my daughter graduating with her Masters from USC, and I wanted her trip to be perfect. These are the things I asked for and was granted without a problem. I requested a high floor away from street noise when first booking the hotel. I was given a complimentary upgrade to a city view to honor our celebration. Both times we stayed, I asked for a AAA discount; I was given it even on the Luxe room. I paid $207 a night. I used the hotel website and reservation line, but I found calling the hotel directly and making my reservation helped prevent some arrival potential problems. The cheif concierge, Joan, helped me get a cake made by the hotel pastry chef in my daughter' s favorite flavors. It was delivered by room service with extra thoughtfulness. They timed the cake arrival for our return after dinner. Joan is very sweet and very professional. The hotel town-car service is a separate business. We had baggage claim pickup at Sea-Tac. The driver Peter was excellent. We appreciated not having to drag our luggage; he took it all even though drivers can no longer park at the curb, but it was a short walk over the skybridge right into his waiting car. It was the only time on the trip other than at the hotel that we had such great service. It was $80.00 for baggage pickup, including tip. 70.00 for the return to the airport. He took a route that avoided traffic, so it was really worth it. He had a sign with my name, and he notified the hotel that we were arriving. Our room was ready when we went to the front desk. A pre-arrival form is sent three days before arrival, if you provide your email address with your reservation. I put in our arrival time and any special requests on this form. I think it makes a difference in letting the hotel know when your arriving. We arrived early, but I asked for them to hold our bags since we were arriving about 2 pm, but we didn't have to wait. The phone and television were what I expected from the hotel web site. Both tv and phone displayed my name, and the tv was playing art scenes when we walked in; I had asked about the art museum at the front desk upon check-in. Long distance and local calls are free with the internet phone system. Upon calling guest service, I received prompt help with extra towels, information, and room service. The fresh berries and Devonshire cream were wonderful. It was berry season, so they were extra fresh. All the room service food was very good. We had no problems using the electronic make-up room or privacy signs. No-one entered the room as noted in some other reviews. A cleaning person did leave a Red-Bull out of the bar. I took it with me when I checked out to show that I had not consumed it. The smart mini-fridge does tell them if anything is missing. They took it off my bill immediately without a problem. One problem, I ran into was gypsy taxis and towncars in Seattle. Orange and green taxis do not have meters and are not legally suppose to stop when flagged, but even if you are flagging yellow cab they try to stop. One driver tried to scam me, but I had enough taxi savy to not fall for it. At the hotel, for our return to the airport, I tried to book our driver directly. It turns out a gypsy company has adopted the name of a family company that has been in business 12 years. They took off a "d" from the end of the name. The good company is Advanced Limosine. I got suspicious from a couple of comments made when I was confirming my reservation. I asked the hotel concierge to confirm by reservation with Peter. She did. Peter arrived promptly. But, a gypsy town car service arrived as well. The driver made a big scene outside. The concierge came to worn me what was happening. The bell man, our driver, and even the hotel management came out to protect us from this driver who had pretended to me that he was sending Peter, who had picked us up at the airport, to to return us to the airport. We saw this happen at the Amtrack station on our return from Canada, as well. A gypsy limosine driver was trying to pick-up new arrivals. From now on, I will let the hotel make our transportation arrangements. But for those that prefer to do their own booking, the company is separate from the hotel, so you can ask the hotel for the town car service that they work with and make your travel arrangements directly with them. The hotel will still allow you to add the transportation to your room bill. We did not have any problems with the privacy shade either as mentioned by other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: EmilyReese
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week…Room was ok, but the service was not good: 1. room did not get serviced every day, we had to call concierge three days in a row to ask for room to be cleaned and towels to be changed; 2. only first couple of days we got regular black coffee and the rest of the days we had to call concierge to ask for regular coffee because we would get only decaf; 3. every time we took shower the water would leak through the opening between shower door and the wall and leave a big puddle of water that we had to put big bath towel on the floor to collect it. Overall, it’s not worth it….for more then $250 a night on an average it could have been much better…

Reviews.Title: “Cool but had some problems”
Reviews.Author: sembrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for the location in Seattle and because we thought it would be so "technologically" impressive. We were disappointed by a few problems. The Good: The decor was nice, the room was mostly clean, and it was very quiet. The view was very nice. The Bad: Arrived to check it at 4pm... their check-in time and had to wait about 30 minutes with many other very unhappy travelers. When we got to our room, about 5 minutes later, a maid walked in without much notice (probably a result of them trying to hurry and get us our room). The tv remote had a broken button, their "engineer" had to come up to give us a new one. The technology was far less than expected or advertised. The Ugly: We bought a bottle of wine from a local store and went to use the complimentary glasses only to find lots of dust and mouth prints. They were quick to bring us new ones. Took a bath in the soaking tub (best bath ever btw) but when I pushed the button to open/close the automatic privacy shade, the thing completely fell down from the ceiling... mounting brackets and all! That was the worst... and then the only thing they did was to give us half off our parking which amounted to about a $15 discount. Over-all the atmosphere was a little hectic, like it is a newer hotel that hasn't ironed out its problems. The "technology" was not all that it was advertised to be, and the rooms were falling apart. We will probably stay in another hotel next time. For the same price we could find an equally, more established hotel that will not have so many problems.

Reviews.Title: “Silly shortcomings and not really 5 star”
Reviews.Author: FlyOneWorld
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 1000 for 3 nights in June in a corner bay view room. (The view was of the port area and an ugly building so I would not pay extra for this view) We arrived at 3:15pm and the room was not ready. Check-in is at 4pm so we said nothing. The front desk promised to call us on my cellphone when the room was ready, nobody called. The room itself is well appointed, large, with an excellent bed and stylish bathroom. The bathtub in the window was cool. The soft bed sheets let you drift away. The location was fairly good as we could walk anywhere in 10 minutes or so. However, we had several observations everyone should note. 1. You will hear street noise. We did on the 9th floor. 2. The hotel has town car drop off service, they fail to tell you this at check in. 3. Our room was not vacuumed and the carpet was dirty. Upon complaint they vacuumed promptly. 4. The TV turns off by itself to reboot the system. This happens often. 5. They don't seem to have a laundry service. 6. For a so called 5 star hotel - there is no shoe mitt or buff, no envelopes or stationary in the room, no slippers, and the hotel directory is short on information. 7. Room service prices are inaccurate, while it is not listed anywhere in the menu book they add large service charges and delivery fees. Not unusual but notice is a good thing. 8. The valet did not know what parking costs. For $400-500 or so a night Hotel 1000 does not deliver real value or stellar service. The Four Seasons will open in November and I will try that before I return to Hotel 1000.

Reviews.Title: “Does not accept cash”
Reviews.Author: da32528
Reviews.Content: This hotel will not accept cash. Any hotel that DOES NOT accept cash at check-in is breaking the hospitality rule of...hospitality...and neglecting to show care and regard for transient's who only use cash.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGirl33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 9 days recently. He was in Seattle for work, and I tagged along to hang out and explore the city. I also brought a day or two of work with me. I was looking forward to seeing the hotel because I heard that David Beckham stayed there a few months ago. We were upgraded to a huge suite, so of course I was able to fantasize that maybe I was sleeping in the SAME BED that David Beckham once slept in! Me, my husband, and the aura of David Beckham, all in that big comfy bed. The bedroom was bigger than our bedroom at home; the bathroom was bigger than our bathroom at home; and the living room was bigger than our living room at home. We even had a dining table that was - you guessed it - bigger than our dining table at home. There were two flat screen TVs, including one in the bedroom, and my husband looooved that. The furnishings were comfortable and I loved the Molten Brown toiletries. I took a couple baths in the neat-o tub and I enjoyed the separate shower with two showerheads. Local and long distance calls were free, and there was free internet access in the living room (either through Wi Fi or a cable that they provide to connect your laptop to the jack in the wall). My only complaint was that the Wi Fi stopped working 3 days into our stay, and the cable was very short. So to use my computer, I had to either sit in an armchair with the laptop balanced on the arm, or sit on the floor with the laptop on the very low coffee table. This was uncomfortable and my legs would cramp up very quickly. The workspace options should be better thought out; I would have loved it if the cable had reached the dining table so that I could have worked there. The location of the hotel is terrific. Just a short stroll to Pike Place Market in one direction, and a short stroll to Pioneer Square in the other. The front desk service was excellent, but I had a few negative experiences with housekeeping. For example, they did not really clean the shower stall. I have thick hair and it was disgusting to watch the hair collect on the drain cover. I know I could have easily cleaned it myself, but I wanted to see how long it would be before they actually cleaned the shower. After a couple more days I had to clean it myself because the water would no longer drain. This was gross, but I consoled myself with the thought that maybe some of David Beckham's hairs were still in the shower, too. On another day, I was in the room working and I had the "Do Not Disturb" light on. Suddenly the door opened and a housecleaner came into the room. She didn't knock or announce herself at all. She seemed genuinely surprised to see me, but not as surprised as I was. I asked her why she came in when the "Do Not Disturb" light was on, and she said it was because she thought we had checked out that day. I said,"'Even if you thought we had checked out, when you saw the 'Do Not Disturb' light on, why didn't you knock or announce yourself?" She just apologized repeatedly and left. So that did not make me feel great about hotel security. What if she had come in while I was taking a bath, or in bed with the aura of David Beckham? Thank heaven I was just working. A couple other notes: The gym in the basement is small, but I liked that it was stocked with towels and bottled water. The free strawberry lemonade in the lobby is really tasty and my husband had a glass every day. Our room was huge, but very dark. If natural light is important to you, ask for a room with larger or more windows. Despite the few service problems, we really enjoyed Hotel 1000 and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000: Stop looking, start booking!!!”
Reviews.Author: sumbloke
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've ever had the pleasure of staying in, absolutely flawless service and facilities that completed a great weekend in Seattle. For such a classy place it has a really relaxed vibe. I'm all for checking out what else is on offer as a general rule, but I wouldn't contemplate staying anywhere else if I was to visit the city again - I doubt anywhere could come close. Well worth every penny. The rooms are sleek and beautifully designed and packed full of tasty complimentary bits and bobs. The beds are amazingly comfortable and the high-tech touches are something else - the ceiling filled bathtub, dividing glass wall wth electric blind, the piped music and the artwork slideshow on the plasma screen - loved it! Nice toiletries too . . . Molton Brown I think. Well placed for everything - Pike Place just up the street, Benaroya Hall around the corner, Pioneer Sq down the hill. Stop trawling through your expedia shortlist now and get this place booked - you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler002
Reviews.Content: We arrived early to Hotel 1000 so the staff took care our luggage for us until check in. At 4:00pm check in our room was not ready so we were upgraded right away to a suite. The room was spacious, clean, plasma tv, great view, neat bathroom. The hotel is also located perfectly for walking the boardwalk, to the market and downtown. The restaurant in the hotel Boka Kitchen and Bar had good food and a fun atmosphere. The only complaint I have about this hotel is the street noise was really bad. The noise from cars and motorcyles bounced off the downtown buildings in our corner suite.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 1000 is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cyndi417
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 1000 for three nights - end of March/first of April, for our 24th anniversary. We were thrilled with the level of service from the moment we stepped foot into the hotel. After check-in everyone - including the doorman - knew and used our names. The concierge was very helpful in making reservations for all the things we wanted to do while in Seattle, including dinner reservations at Canlis (out of this world food)! We booked our stay directly through the Hotel 1000 website and stayed in a Grand Luxe Parlor Suite. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were wonderful. Loved the fill from the ceiling tub, too. We travel a great deal and this was one of the best hotel's we have ever stayed in - including Wynn in Las Vegas! Will definately stay here again on our return trips to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay for Seattle visitor”
Reviews.Author: johnzzz
Reviews.Content: I selected Hotel 1000 for a corporate event on the recommendation from a friend who lives in Seattle. I was EXTREMELY PLEASED with this hotel on every front; in fact, before leaving I booked several nights for my wife and I to have a romantic weekend getaway at a great hotel and beautiful city. You'll love the rooms: beds, plasmas, bathrooms, lighting, service, restaurants, everything. The only thing I could put in the semi-negative column would be the normal priciness of a big-city boutique hotel. But even this would be a nit pick - the prices are very competitive and yet you get to stay at a hotel that is arguably when of the best I've every visited and I'm an extremely frequent traveler around the world...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LadyJulie
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hotel 1000 based on TripAdvisor reviews and the location, and we are glad we did. Hotel 1000 excels in service and making your stay as pleasant as possible. It was wonderful to have a pre-arrival form emailed to us in order to make airport transfer arrangements, and an itinerary was emailed back to me within 15 mins. of making a request!. The bed was extremely comfortable and the lighting was excellent, complete with dimmer switches to match the lighting to your mood. The bathroom was beautiful and large. The frosted glass door on the toilet room took a bit of getting used to, however, as far as privacy. We loved the location of the hotel and were able to get to Pike Place Market, the monorail to Seattle Center, the waterfront, and Pioneer Square all by walking a few blocks. Some walks did involve hills, but the hotel staff were able to share some flatter routes. We would also recommend Boka, the hotel restaurant, for a great meal. We would definitely return to Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “What An Awesome Place!!”
Reviews.Author: pcmpapacherry
Reviews.Content: Wow! I booked this hotel for a trip to celebrate my best friends birthday. She had never stayed in a nice hotel, and I wanted it to be really special. When we pulled up to the Hotel, two valets came rushing out, and alerted the front desk that we had arrived. We were checked in, in about 5 minutes tops. I had let them know that I was coming for my friends birthday, and they gave her a free spaahh facial, (which she said was incredible)! Now, on to the rooms. Geez, what a place! When we opened the door, classical music was playing on the fourty inch television, very well decorated, and it smelled terrific! The bathroom was amazing. It had a frosted glass shower door, as well as one hiding the commode, and a huge seperate deep soaking tub. The coolest part was that the water to fill the tub comes from the ceiling!! There is a glass wall with a optional retractable shade that seperated the bathroom from the room itself. The lotions, and soaps were amazing. It was the nicest hotel I have stayed at in Seattle, and I have stayed in all of them! ALSO, is was cheaper than most of them! I loved it! It's the only place that I ever want to stay again! Oh, and the bed and linens were just amazing! I can't wait to go back next month!! It doesn't hurt that everyone who works there is gorgeous either!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel on 1st street”
Reviews.Author: CuriouslyStrong4me
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are v. friendly and go extra steps to ensure guests are comfortable. Examples during our stay: we bought a case of wine from a local store, and the front desk delivered it to our room promptly. We were notified on our Cisco phone via a text message -- very cool touch. We called for a cab twice, once local and once to the airport, but were offered the hotel's town car for use (free, and for the same price as a cab, respectively). I think we got a fantastic room, but could have paid less, according to some other reviewers here. Sounds like our $335 room is exactly like or very similar to someone who paid $225 during the same month of stay. I agree with everything pompom79 says about the hotel. My husband & I found it annoying that in Seattle of all places, there was no alternative music selection in the TVs music channels. Music in the bathroom would have been nice. The hotel is proud of the digital art on the TV; however, our TV display has already been burned by leaving the TV on most of the time; an ever-present ghost scroll bar is distracting. The location is very convenient - easy walks to ball fields, pier, and Pike's Market. we were v. surprised at how reasonable the mini-bar items were: $17 for a 1/2 bottle of a nice, drinkable Dunham blend; $4 or so for a beer; $7 for a bath fizzy.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top-rated hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: pompom79
Reviews.Content: I'm a complete hotel snob after having been subjected to too many highway motels on childhood road trips - call it my form of adolescent rebellion, but since I was old enough to book my own trips, I've never been able to deal with anything less than a 4* hotel. That being said, I do try to find the best deal possible, and have been lucky enough to have stayed in some gorgeous rooms at great prices over the years. Hotel 1000, though, tops the list. My husband and I were heading down to Seattle for a concert and wanted someplace chic, comfortable and close to the venue. After reading Hotel 1000's reviews, there was no question as to where we'd be staying. We booked their most basic room for $225/night, which turned out to anything but basic. The bathroom was incredibly large, with a shower, 2-person ceiling-filled tub, and wonderful amenities, including a loofah sponge. The room itself was massive (we were in a corner room, slightly larger than the regular basic rooms, I believe), with an incredibly comfortable bed. Turndown service left little chocolates on the pillow, we very much enjoyed the French press-brewed Starbucks coffee, and the robes were simply sumptuous. Free wifi and VOIP calls are a nice touch and would make this a perfect place for an extended business stay. Beyond the room, the hotel itself is very nice - intimate and very stylish. There's delicious complementary strawberry lemonade in the lobby, a treat almost as sweet as the staff. I have never yet encountered a staff as gracious and helpful as Hotel 1000's - from the valets who greeted us (and happily retrieved some items we had left in the car when we called down), to the concierge and front desk staff, everyone we encountered was having a great time doing their jobs - their pride in their place of work certainly shows. A fabulous stay, and I don't think I could stay anywhere else in Seattle after having experienced Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable & Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: kliz15
Reviews.Content: Hotel 1000 lives up to the hype. We had a corner room on the 12th floor. The view swept from Mount Rainer & the Stadiums, around to the Sound and Bainbridge Island. It was gorgeous. We were fortunate as the weather was in the low 80's and there wasn't a cloud in the sky. So the city was incredibly gorgeous around the hotel. When we arrived the valet was prompt and polite in taking care of us. We went to check in at 4 and they were doing a final run through on our room. We waited no more than 5 minutes, and our keys were issued. I discovered the heavenly fresh strawberry lemonade in the lobby as I waited! What a treat! Good stuff. When we arrived in our room, it had the fragrance of cleanliness. As if they had spritzed lysol to give it some freshness. It was nice. We of course were taken back by the beautiful views first. Then pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. There was a nice seating area at the end of the room that we weren't expecting. The linens on the bed were heavenly. So soft, almost as smooth as satin. The bed was comfortable, but it wasn't the most steady. It was unusually bouncy. I felt every turn from my husband as he slept. But it wasn't that bad. I'm just used to my Beauty Rest at home and the Westin Heavenly bed (Which is the same mattress.) Hotel 1000 has better sheets...I guess you can't have it all. The bathroom was huge. And I loved the full sized soaps, lotions & hair products throughout. I didn't have time to bathe but the tub was cool. If the weather wasn't so nice, I might have been indoors more and enjoyed a bath. But we were on the go and barely there. I liked the rain shower, but it's mounted on the wall which I found odd. I'm used to it being mounted over head and cascading down. All the fixtures are Kohler and very high end. Even the toilet is high end. Be mindful that if you stay here, there are certain "givens." The sounds of the city can be heard from your room (honking, music, boat horns...the general hustle and bussle of a downtown city). It didn't bother me on the 12th floor much. But my husband's mom was on the 8th floor and found it distracting. Also, getting around town is often difficult. There are many one way streets and going a mile can take a lot longer than expected. But it goes with the territory so it didn't bother me. We took the ferry over to bainbridge island. I recommend the trip. You catch the ferry a few blocks from the hotel. I think it was $12 for the car and driver and $6 for additional passengers. The boat was fun. And the island was beautiful. Cherry blosoms were in bloom too. It's much like the east coast...Nantucket feel. We came back on the 7:10 boat and had a gorgeous sunset cruise. So amazing! Took a day trip to Canada too. Got lucky and the boarder lines were short. We waited no more than 10 minutes on either side. The drive to Victoria was about 2 1/2 hours each way. For those of you who are from big cities...be prepared. The Northwestern Crowd drive the speed limit. I CA we go 70-80 on a regular basis...they go 50-60! Plan on being patient. Very impressive hotel, and fantastic location. I forgot to mention only a mile from Qwest and Safeco field. We drove to the stadum to see the Mariners/Angels game. But you could have walked. Parking was $20. Oh, and our last day there we woke up to tradiatinal Seattle weather. Gloomy, drizzling and cold. Sadly, you couldn't see Mt. Rainer or the island. So if it's not clear...you may not get to see the impressive views. That's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Massage!”
Reviews.Author: Kpartlow1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel 1000 with my boyfriend. Great arrival experience. My bf couldn't get enough of the complimentary strawberry-lavendar infused lemonade available near the front desk. I think he smuggled about 10 cups of it over the course of our stay! Our room was the 4th floor. I definitely recommend asking for a higher room. While our view of 1st street directly below us was okay, I would have preferred a view of the water. The massage I had at the Spa was amazing! Definitely one of the best massages I've ever had. My boyfriend and I used the fitness center (a bit small but nice) and the library on the 4th floor, a really cute place to sit by the fire. The location of Hotel 1000 was also great. We walked everywhere - only 10 minutes to Pike Place and near the pier. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty French Press”
Reviews.Author: uncosito
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at Hotel 1000. Probably the last...why don't I learn. It's a great looking hotel and I LOVE the bathroom and tub, but why can't they clean a french press?! It's disgusting. The french press smells like rancid coffee oils and you can see the coffee residue and oils on the various parts. Take a look if you choose to stay here. Pull apart the filter and see how many coffee grounds you find between the pieces. Just a note: there shouldn't be any. Wipe a napkin around the lid and on the bottom of the filter plate and see how much coffee grime comes off. If you get any, it's not clean. I expect more for $200 plus a night and four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Luxury & Technology”
Reviews.Author: Rusty2280
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a contemporary room with the latest technology in the downtown area of Seattle, THIS IS THE PLACE. Sony plasma televisions on the wall of each guest room have excellent sound and HD programs, however you may find as I did, to be glued to the hotel's personal channels showing HD photographs of scenes from around the world set to soothing music. Mention you like golf to the excellent staff at the front desk when you check in, and when you enter your room, classical music will be playing and the television will be set to the channel showing the greatest golf courses of the world. There are approximately a dozen channels that feature photographic slide shows on subjects from sailing to hiking to tropical resorts. Seriously cool. Of COURSE everyone will mention the bathroom with the glass wall opening into the bedroom and the tub that fills from the ceiling, this is a luxury, spa like setting and the bathroom is almost as state of the art as their technology. WIFI is throughout the hotel's common areas and in each guest room. The telephones are VOIP technology with guides to the hotel, the area and the nightlife right on the phone screen. Ask the front desk for a water view room if possible, facing west, although I imagine the city view rooms are just as spectacular. The hotel restaurant, BOKA is a wise choice for happy hour (with tapas-style "urban bites" for half price as well as the drinks). A golf club with two golf simulator bays is in the lower level of the hotel along with their fitness center and spaaaah (as they call it). Plan to check out the golf simulator during happy hours weekdays for 1/2 price golf and drinks, almost feels like your on the course. The staff is unbelievable, service is efficient and professional, the only delay in any service is getting your car from the hotel valet (as they have to park it off-site). The hotel's location is at 1st and Madison, an easy walk to Pike Place Market, the Seattle Art Museum, the waterfront, ferries and numerous restaurants. Rates were decent for this level of service, around $200 per night, ask for the AAA discount, it's not officially offered, but the great reservations people will give you a discount to match. Call them now if you are planning a trip to Seattle for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. I'd return in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Wonderful service. Plus: * Great location * I arrived early, and while my room was not ready, they were very accommodating regarding my desire to change and freshen up. * I had a corner room, and while other corners would have a view of the water, my room was great. Lots of room, big TV with art/music channels, very very comfortable. * Very comfortable bed. Prompt room service. * Nice area for breakfast and drinks * free high speed internet, wired and wireless. Cons: * Parking was pricey * None that I can think of. For any business/pleasure downtown, this is a great place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: 2DOTGuys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the long MLK weekend in January 2008. Everything met our expectations. The staff was professional, friendly, and very helpful. The location made seeing Seattle on foot easy. The room was wonderful (great design and a great bathroom) and had a great view of Elliot Bay and the Olympic Mountains across Puget Sound. We also enjoyed the spa services and Boka restaurant, which was quite excellent. We will definitely stay there again the next time we go to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “What a disapointment!”
Reviews.Author: godiva2012
Reviews.Content: After reading the 5-star reviews and getting a recommendation from a few locals, we checked into the Hotel 1000. We booked one of their bigger suites with 2 flat screen TVs, luxury bath, etc. While the staff was quite friendly and the concierge helpful, my problems were with the lack of basic amenities and cleanliness of the bathrooms. My first morning at the hotel, I entered the granite shower with 2 showerheads trying to figure out how to turn the 2 faucets on without getting soaked in cold water, for the knobs were at the far end of the shower and there was no way of avoiding the spray. That was the least of my problems because after I recovered from the ice bath, followed by the scorching heat of the hard-to-adjust temperature setting I realized that there is absolutely no water pressure. There was barely any water trickling out of the shower heads which made it impossible to rinse. Second shock? While fiddling with the temperature knob, I pulled off a wad of someone’s hair on my hand. Minutes later I noticed more foreign hair on the shower walls, Gross! After 10 minutes of trying to rinse unsuccessfully, I decided to just rinse my hair in the sink (which became my daily routine for the next 5 days). There is absolutely no water pressure at all. The next day, I decided to give the soaking tub a try. My first attempt to fill the tub, produced a tub full of dirty sudsy water- apparently they never rinsed it off from the previous guest, so I set out to clean the tub myself. On my 3rd attempt to fill the tub, I noticed that my bath bubbles were gray and dirty. My next grievance is that for such a large bathroom, they give you only one tiny piece of soap (the size of a silver dollar), which you have to carry from the shower, to the sink, to the tub. After 6 days at this hotel, it was never refilled with a new one. While I admire the city’s commitment to conserving water, a functioning shower and a bar of soap are a must for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel087
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel 1000 for three nights and it was definitely an experience to remember! This hotel is considered a "four star" hotel, but we both felt that it could easily be a "five star." First off, the hotel ambiance is extremelly relaxing and peaceful. It is somewhat dark inside and decorated with darker hues, but in a way that is very calming. The rooms are absolutely unbelievable. We had a king waterview and though we paid a little more for the view, the windows were huge and gave us a great view of the Sound. There were also lots of nice touches like a flat screen that is personalized during your stay, a great bed with nice linens and lots of storage space. The room was a little small, but more than adequate for us! The bathroom is to die for - I would love to have a duplicate made for my home!
